The server did a great job of making sure we were taken care of.  We ordered a couple of appetizers.  They were the brie with a glaze and the other was a sausage one.  They both were really good.  
I ordered that jaeger schnitzel and it was super good.  It came with potatoes and a side of what looked like a coleslaw.  The food was really good.  We ordered the cherry and apple strudels too when done.  The apple was really good.  They seem to be all natural (no sugar seem to be added).  It came with a side of whip cream that was good too.  
I would have like to have some beers but I was driving.  
The server did a great job and he got a good tip.  
Give this place a try.  I have a feeling you will not be disappointed.

Nice restaurant with good food. I had the Jaeger Schnitzel which came with potatoes and a cabbage and sour cream type side that was my favorite part. The Schnitzel was tender and the sauce on it was very flavorful. The potatoes were ok, nothing fantastic but good. We were a large group so I understand slower service so that isn't my complaint, my reason for not 5 stars is the waiter gave us a hard time about ordering any drinks while we waited for a few more people. The first table designated to us was full and he said he didn't want to take drink orders till everyone was there. He ended up doing it but wasn't to happy about it. That is fine but not great customer service. I have only been to one other German restaurant and I liked their food just slightly better but this was very good and I would return with a smaller party!

YUM. One of our favorite restaurants!   An absolute referral.  Friendly staff.  Music is fun and so are the other diners.  Food is outstanding!   I've had German food elsewhere and it was heavy and greasy.  Not true here!  Very good filling food!   Go for the beer as well - authentic goodness.  Not cheap but worth it!

I really wanted this place to be better.  Great atmosphere ... they had a band playing, the servers were in fun outfits, and there's a giant pretzel outside.  Unfortunately that's pretty much all this place has going for it.  The food was decent (I had the Jagerschnitzel which the staff raved about, and an apple strudel), and the beers were of course great.  Overall worth checking out if you're in Downtown Glendale, but I likely won't be coming back.

I ate beets.  How great is that!
I hate beets.

Quality vs Quantity
Quality vs Server Knowledge

Tough call on the rating.
Food taste was terrific thoughout.
German salad (included beets), soup with meal and sauerbraten.
All tasty.

The beets on the German salad were very tasty and I hate beets.
Server knowledge - I just had a beet epiphany and asked how they were prepared.  Shrug - they are beets.  Another person who brought my main course to the table equally clueless.

Bean soup included with the meal - delicious.

Sauerbraten, red cabbage and spaetzle very tasty.

However- barely ate lunch in anticipation of a beefy dinner.
2 thin slices of sauerbraten.  Seriously?

Sauerbraten should be a hearty meal, not a deli slice.

4 stars with a nod to a reasonable amount of meat.
5 stars if the waiter knew a few details about the food.

Return -  the schnitzels did sound awful good...........

There was a festival in downtown Glendale and we were hungry so after we browsed some Yelp reviews, we decided to stop by Haus Murphy's. It was fairly busy, even at a later hour, but we were promptly seated. Our waitress came by and got us our drink order. We had ordered a couple of beers, which took a while for them to come but they were pretty good as expected.

I will preface this review by saying that I've never had German food before so I didn't really know what I was in for. We were really hungry so we started with the mushroom appetizer dish. It was definitely interesting - The filling was really mushy but flavorful; the cheese sauce it came with was the highlight on the plate. We also got the chicken schnitzel for our main meal. It was really bland / tasteless, mainly super greasy and sides that the meal came with weren't much better. Of course all of this was served up for a pretty pricey ticket. I'm not sure if I just don't like German food or what, but I don't see us coming back.

The hubby is half German, so whenever we can find German food, we have to have some.  This place is good.  Has a good Schnitzel( and big!).  We have been here twice and enjoyed both times.  We came yesterday and enjoyed the food.  
Had a Jagerschnitzel, and although it was good, the gravy was sparse and a bit bland.  My hubby had the ziguenerschnitzel, which was tasty.  Really enjoyed the potatoes and the new cabbage dish.
The service was good, price is still fine.  I saw in a previous review that someone grumped about the new menus.  Its not the menu that brings me into a place, its the food!

So my German mother came in to town so we gave the Haus a try.  I enjoyed the deep fried brie very much, and she loved the potato pancakes.  Very good food, and fun atmosphere, even one a German mother can enjoy!

Had the Haus Goulash. Maybe my expectations were too high it was just ok. The meat seemed dry like it was made a week ago. Was really looking forward to trying this place. Will give it another shot and see if the schnitzel is fresh.

Great meal from the mint hot chocolate drink to the jäger schnitzel ( fried pork tenderloin with mushroom sauce) and fried potatoes.  Can't forget the great appetizers, stuffed mushrooms and Bavarian pretzel.

Ruben Sandwich and the Vodka pasta are delish!  I tried another dish that my hubby ordered and that was great too (don't remember what it was).  Also, the German margarita was good!  This place fits perfect in downtown Glendale!  We will Def return.

New to Phoenix and was looking or a good German restaurant.  Decided to try Haus Murphy's and glad I did.  Typical German decor, excellent service and the food was very good.  I had the Paprika Schnitzel but was unsure of the Paprika sauce.  The server was very cool and gave me a dish of the traditional beef mushroom sauce just in case.  They were both excellent.  We also tried the Huhner (Chicken) Schnitzel and that was very good as well.  Top it off with a liter of dark beer and it was a great dinner. The portions were so large we did not have room for desert but they looked like they would be good as well.

I will definitely be going back.

Most hospitable owner in town! Had the opportunity to stop in during December, Downtown Glendale has the light display so you expect it to be busy. Well, the wonderful owner first told us they were out of food, so busy, so sorry - wait a minute! She told us to be seated and asked us what to drink, proceeded to bring out two schnitzel plates, the last dishes in there - then she comped them! We had a wonderful meal, we are so glad we stopped in. Definitely will be visiting this place every chance we get!

I've been to Haus Murphy's several times over the last few years. It has always been a great experience. The food is decently priced, the service has always been quick,  and the staff have always been extremely helpful.

With regard to the food, I have always been very pleased. The food is always fresh, portions are generous and the taste is amazingly authentic. If you are looking for a great German meal, you cannot go wrong with any selection.

On of the few downsides is that on days when downtown Glendale is having an event, the lunch menu is scrapped for a slimmed down dinner menu. This can be disappointing if you are looking forward to a lunch item. Luckily, their dinner menu has plenty of alternatives. If you live as far out as I do, just be sure and check Glendale's event calendar or call the restaurant. 

Also, be prepared to search for parking. Most spots are free, but depending on what is going on downtown, parking fills up fast.

We were shopping in Glendale and got a little hungry.  We decided to stop for a beer and pretzel in Haus Murphy's inviting bier garten.  Once we looked at the menu, however, we just HAD to order some lunch!  Everything looked so tempting!  We ordered Gulasch mit spatzel, Jager Schnitzel and beer.  Everything was delicious.  Both my parents are German so  I grew up on this type of cuisine.  The meal took me back to dinner at Oma's and Opa's house.  Wonderful comfort food!!  We didn't order dessert because we were really full from our entrees.  I'm looking forward to trying the sauerkraut chocolate cake next time!

Being total novices to German cuisine- this was a great place to start.  Fun atmosphere from the restaurant decor to the servers attire and then we ordered!  We sat outside and enjoyed the lovely Glendale evening, a wonderful beir as suggested by our server and a giant German Pretzel hot out of the oven!  We relied on our server and ordered one of his suggestions- a combo meal with German sausage, smoked pork, potatoes and German potato salad (not as good as my Moms - but tasty) all was wonderful!

We stopped in the middle of the afternoon. First, we ordered a pretzel with cheese. They were out of cheese. Then, we ordered the bratwurst with fries. They were out of fries. So, we ordered the bratwurst sandwich with potatoes. They were incredibly slow for it being a slow afternoon. Finally, our food came. The bratwurst had no bun. She explained they had no buns. I would think they could have offered a substitute or lowered our bill, but they didn't. I don't understand why they were out of basic staples for their restaurant. It made for a frustrating dining experience. The food was very average, as well as the service.

beer.. sausage.. pork patties.. potatoes.. pickled cabbage.
mmm then nap time.

anytime i find a german bier garden I try my hardest to get to it and considering i was only in AZ for a couple days i thought it was a good chance to try haus murphy's.. 

from the looks of things from pictures from other yelpers it looked promising.. 
figured i'd get some good beer and brats.

so by the time i made it out there i was starving and we still had to wait for 2 more people to show... this could have added to my crankiness because i think we waited for 30 minutes watching every car drive by.

it would have probably made me feel better to get a beer first but i didn't want to go in by myself considering the kitchen staff came out to stare while i was doing a walk through to check out what we were dealing with.

so most of the patrons had white/silver hair.. and it looked like they were celebrating life.

it's more homestyle than i thought it would be but when you hear beer garden and lounge.. you think it should be more happening but it was a thursday night in glendale and the place closes at 9.. i should have put it all together.

the place is huge.. it's actually the restaurant for the first half of the building then the backside is the lounge.. then alongside the entire building is the beer garden.

it was a nice nite out so we decided to stay outside in the beer garden.

the service is nice and helpful.. it's too bad the food didn't cut it.
their brats were spongy.. weisswurt had a different spice in it i couldn't put my finger on and the only sausage on the baunerplatte that was decent was knack wurst.. but that's just like a regular hot dog.

their mustard was just the generic haines spicy brown mustard... i think they could have made it much more authentic or gone with something with more flavor.. 

the schniztel was good.. but nothing more than a breaded cutlet.. which is what it is.. and i'd rather get it with donkatsu sauce at a japanese place.. the kossler kotelett.. is explained as a boiled pork chop.. which if you really think about it.. it's a slice of ham..  which it was.. and nothing too spectacular..

all the meats were pilled on top of either sauerkraut or pickled red cabbage and then on the sides of the plate were fried potatoes and the german potato salad.. nothing more than diner style fried potatoes.. but i did not get to try the potato salad because my non food adventurous friends got to it first.

the highlight is the atmosphere.. it's very welcoming and you have different sections to sit in depending on what you want to make of your night..

they have an awesome beer selection.. i wanted the spaten oktoberfest but they ran out and got me a different oktoberfest edition beer..
but the one that took the cake was the warstener dunkle.. 
it's a brown ale.. but it's so light and crisp you'd think it was a blonde.. 
it's absolutely delicious.. i was so jealous i didn't get it.. and even more so when my friend was billed $5 for his 32 oz and i had a 16 oz of the oktoberfest.. sheesh.. 
the other item i can vouch for is the soup of the day which was potato soup.. i didn't think i would care for it because we had the mount of potatoes and pickled cabbage.. but the soup was my favorite.. it was perfectly seasoned.. and pureed... and dipping their prebought buns into the soup was delicious.. it's a shame both the bread and the soup were the smallest in portion out of everything.

i still prefer red lion tavern in LA or hofbrauhaus in vegas...

but haus murphy's food did do the sleep trick.. i went back to my friends place and took a nap.. i don't know.. something about the beer and sausage mix that just makes me want to sleep right after.. it's worse than turkey dinners!

i forgot to mention they now serve absinthe..

Wow. What has happened to this place? Talk about a downhill slide.

Went for dinner last week. Talked this place up to a family friend from out of town who is of German heritage. We were all excited to go. That faded quickly as soon as we walked up.

Usually there's a hostess to greet you next to the big pretzel. Been that way for years. This time, nobody, and it was far from being busy on a week night at 6pm. 2 tables occupied on the patio, and about a dozen tables inside. Walked around the entire restaurant like tards looking for someone to seat us. Finally found one of the regular waiters (of the 2 they had working that shift) to seat us. 

Menus have changed drastically from my last visit. Used to have a normal menu book, now those have been replaced with a poorly executed, Waffle House style placemat menu. Very low brow and a pain in the ass when you're flipping back and forth to decide on something. Only the beer/wine list page remains from the old menus. Thinned out a lot of the choices, too.

Ambience has changed a lot in the bar area. The place always could have used a makeover, and they did one, but went the wrong direction. The big banquet-style picnic tables are gone and in their place are horrible cheap retirement home-spec dining tables and chairs. Poorly painted German flag colors, a big tv, and no more interesting shit on the walls. Looks to me like they're trying to turn the back into a sports bar, but it's poorly executed.

Beer. Usually a highlight. Didn't even order one this time. They typically rotate a random beer in from time to time. I was told by our less than attentive and less than friendly waiter that they never do that. I guess I imagined the oddball, grapefruitish beer that I had never had before which my girlfriend ordered last time. Prices went up, too. Years ago, a liter was $9, now its $13-14. Entrees are also more, as is the pretzel. Didn't order one of those, either. 

I was pretty turned off by the service and atmosphere at this point, but I figured I'd let the food make up my mind. 

It did. And I'll never be back. My brat was dried out and overcooked. My girlfriends dish (pan fried chicken with some kind of sauce) was bland and the chicken was VERY dry. The red cabbage was flavorless and appeared/tasted canned, a far cry from how it used to be. My dad's stuffed cabbage dish was also flavorless, and we deduced that his entire dish is basically what gets mixed into their house soup every day. The "German Potato Salad" has devolved into fried potatoes with some chunks of bacon and parsley thrown in. Pathetic, and definitely not what it used to be.

We left at 7, horribly disappointed. The patio, which is usually pretty busy starting this time of year, was completely deserted when we walked out.

Haus Murphy used to be one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix, but their apparent attempt to appeal to the masses, coupled with a steady decline in service and quality, has left me to look elsewhere to find good German food.

Diners, Drive-ins and Disappointments

This is the fifth place Guy has gone in the valley and that I have tried and it was another so-so spot.

My wife and I are used to eating at Bavarian Point and Zur Kate in the east valley and enjoy both places.  We have also eaten at The Rheinlander in Portland a number of times.

We made the drive from Chandler to Glendale to try something new.  We started off with the Käse Spätzle which they say is German style Mac and Cheese.  The dish was good but had too much oinon, especially for a kids meal.

The kids also the chicken strips and fries.  They enjoyed the fries but the breading on the chicken was not kid friendly (my wife thought it was made with rye).

My wife and I had sausage plates, they were ok but unremarkable. The potato salad had very large chucks of potato that I wish were cooked a little more and the red cabbage was sweet, not tangy, and could have used some more simmer time.  The Speigl was great.

the food took close to an hour to make it to the table and the place was not busy.  We were told this was longer than usual but weren't given an explanation.  

The servers seemed friendly.

I had been anxious to visit this restaurant based upon the rave reviews from my son and his many visits with his German club.  I found the atmosphere to be delightful - I could picture myself in Germany based upon the decorations.  If you love to eat meat and like German cooking, this place is perfect.  I prefer non meat dishes but ended up having a steak cooked German style - it was very good.  Service was not exceptional, but was OK.

We visited for the first time last weekend and the food was very good.

The Paprika schnitzel was perfect and the sausage appetizer was excellent as well.

The only draw back, the two "hosts" were younger and disinterested. Almost as if they were put out by more customers. The waitress was a bit slow and forgetful but, the meal more than made up for it!

We would definitely go back for seconds!

First time at Haus Murphey's and super impressed. Best German food since Germany. Had the paprika schnitzel and wife had the spicy bratwurst. Naturally we had to have a German beer too. Too bad we live in the SE Valley and it's a trek to get there or we would be there more often.
Love this place. Atmosphere is great, food fantastic, beer amazing, and the staff wonderful.  Have been here many times and have never been disappointed.

I had never tried authentic German food so this was an experience for sure. The place is nicely decorated and the staff was very helpful with their recommendations. My favorite was the gazpacho! I will definitely be coming back and trying something different on the menu.

Very disappointed.   Took my husband for the sauerbraten that he had heard so much about and it did not live up to the hype. I had the special turkey schnitzel and the peaches were not fresh but canned and not grilled by any means. The meatloaf that another person had was very dry.  Service was good which is the reason for two stars and not one.   Wouldn't recommend. They obviously knew the food network was coming. Too bad the general public doesn't deserve the same quality.
Make sure you stop in for Beer, delicious food and  Gemutlichkeit! Carleen took care of us and her service was excellent ! Great oompapa ! Good times! Prosit

We went here to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The food was outstanding when you take into consideration that I have had this food in Germany. The roulade was delicious, however anyone who has had this dish knows that regular German mustard is a must. We actually had to ask for the mustard which came in Spicy German mustard. That maybe due to the fact that we live in the southwest region of the U.S. My wife is Austrian and she thoroughly enjoyed the roulade.  The  schaebischn Spatle was good.
My Paprika schnitzel was great  I would definitely go back again. The service was a little slow, due to the fact that it was PACKED...... Guy Fiere
Was right this place is right on the money......If only we could have real 
German beer instead of the American version of German bier.. I would say that coming from an Austrian and an American who has spent two tours of Germany this place is the go to place for Awesome German-Ausrian food.
Very good Traditional German cuisine with excellent service provided by our waitress Corrine.

This is my favorite German restaurant! It is mouth watering delicious and they have lots of very authentic food items.  Wonderful atmosphere too with live music on Friday's! I bring my little dog there all the time and they love her! They even wait on her too and bring her fresh water and a sausage!

Where are the zero stars? I was raving about this place to my mom on the way to downtown Glendale because I have been here before...got seated pretty quickly, but our server (whose name I wouldn't even know because he never introduced himself) was less than friendly. When we ordered he let us know they may be out of one of our lunch choices, so he went to check and sure enough they didn't have it..so we ordered something else and he went back and put the order in. After about 10 minutes or so a lady(I'm assuming maybe the manager) came back to our table and let us know that they didn't have the other item we ordered either...are you kidding me?? I understand on the menu it says limited availability, but come on...how about your servers let your customers know ahead of time that certain menu items may not be ready yet, or better yet OUT!! The manager did offer another option but at that point we were upset and wanted to leave! We ended up taking our business over to the hop shop and it is amazing! Get your shit together haus murphys!!


Oh and from a former server and current restaurant manager, to whoever our awful server was...learn a thing or two about customer service, it goes a long way even if the food is out of stock!

I am half first generation German, and have lived and spent time in Germany, so I was super excited to finally try Haus Murphy's. My coworker and I stopped in for lunch, and I give them 3/5 stars. 

I ordered the spicy bratwurst, and asked if it came with a roll. At first the waitress thought I wanted a hot dog bun, so I clarified that I was asking for a Broetchen--she had no clue what that meant. I simplified, and asked if they had a dinner roll they could give me. The rolls that they had available were really soft, not the crusty Broetchen I am used to having with a brat. I was disappointed, but the roll was still okay. 

The sauerkraut was spot on--juniper berries and all. I could have easily eaten twice as much had come with the meal. The potatoes were okay, but could have used more seasoning. The bratwurst was absolutely delicious, and paired really well with the spicy and flavorful mustard (I believe horseradish mustard) that was offered.

Service was quick, and my iced tea never ran dry. The waitress was polite and attentive, even during the lunch rush. 

The lunch menu didn't have a weisswurst on it, which is my favorite kind of sausage. I also wish their potato pancakes had been available! 

I'm going to check out the other German restaurants in Phoenix, but am not against visiting Haus Murphy's again.

this place is wonderful! I love it. the stuffed mushrooms are very good. They have a German band on the weekends. The pretzel is also very good, well I can go on and on with the good food. The German margarita you will have to try!

If you go in remembering that good quality food takes time to make, you will enjoy the experience.  The cold beer was great.  Then came the music - loads of fun for my older Polish Momma.  The mushroom appetizer was beautifully presented and quite tasty.  My goulash was superb.  Sit back, relax and enjoy the atmosphere - I promise you the food is worth the wait.

This place is AWESOME ! My dining companion and I ordered a sampler platter , and deserts, it was fantastic. I would recommend this establishment to anyone who wants authentic German cuisine. The service was excellent , and the place was filling up, and it was early afternoon on a Sunday, I hear they do a great Oktoberfest.

We have a german food obsession in the family. The pretzel app., hello carbs why are you so good? Potato pancakes, good. Father had veal schnitzel he approved, my mom had one of the pork ones and she felt the pretzel crust dried it out a bit too much, oh well. Excellent service and atmosphere,  we had the pleasure of sitting outside in the bier garten. There was even entertainment,  oompah-style. Fantastic. Oh, and we came here due to the kick of going to an eatery that's been featured on triple d.

The service was not the most prompt and we waited for quite some time for our drinks and food. That being said we came here the night of Glendale glitters so in fairness they were packed. It may have been a fluke. The beers were fantastic and the perfect temperature and the food was very good and extremely authentic. We definitely will go back, maybe during a less busy time.

I'd give no stars is possible, this place is terrible, I don't know what happened but the service, food, and atmosphere has gone in the toilet. The bathrooms are a filthy mess, the staff is incompetent, and there food is nowhere near GERMAN. Oh and what kind of German Resturant flys the Mexican flag? No American flag too be found, only Mexico and Cardinals flags, should of knew then what this place was about. I won't be back to this place...

Located in downtown Glendale. Walking into Haus Murphys is like walking into another country. I've never been to Germany so I wouldn't know if its authentic or not but as a native I know its definitely not the normal AZ restaurant. The food is pretty good and unlike most dishes that I've had elsewhere. Some of its pretty tasty and some of its not so much my style. The standouts are the schnitzels, meat loaf, sausage, and brew. They serve beer in these huge mugs that are super tasty. There is also a couple of dressed up polka type guys who sing and play music throughout the night. My sister loves Haus Murphys and its always fun to go with her and try different things. If you are a fan of German food or German beer I'm pretty sure this is the best place you can go to in Arizona. I'd probably give the food a 3.5 but the ambiance and the killer brew and sheer size of the mugs deserve an overall 4.

Drove 30 minutes to get there and was excited to try a highly rated German restaurant which are hard to find.  First off, our server Nikki was fabulous.  Professional, friendly and aiming to please.  The sauerkraut puffs were a disappointment.  Mostly mashed potatoes fried.  No sauerkraut flavor.  The cream of chicken Florentine was delicious; properly seasoned and full of spinach, sun dried tomatoes and chunks of chicken.  My Wiener schnitzel was wonderful in texture, but lacked seasoning.  Needed a little garlic salt maybe.  The creamed wising on the side was blah and just luke warm.  The German potatoes looked like they'd just been reheated (maybe several times!).  My husband's sauerbraten was just ok.  His purple sauerkraut was excellent, but the spaetzle were tasteless doughy worms.  Was excited to try the apple strudel which is made on site.  Unfortunately, it was not fresh.  The pastry was mushy and apples overdone.  I think if they tweaked thing a bit more it would be a better experience.

How hilarious that two stars is "Meh" because that famous phrase of Larry David's was how I was going to begin this review.

The giant pretzel? So so, probably microwaved. The menu is fairly pedestrian- why is it so hard to find German food other than wursts, schnitzels, saurbraten, and the occasional rouladen? Oh yeah, the smoked pork chops too- the kassler whatever. There's so much more to German food.

First course was a soup not congruous with a German eatery. I don't remember exactly what it was, some cream soup that should have been called cream of milk.

My companion had a stew or goulash that was on offer that night. He liked it, but then again he's from St. Louis and thinks that Steak N Shake burgers are the shizzle.

I had a sampler platter, don't remember what side dishes came with it, I believe they were generous and fairly tasty- not sublime, but tasty, albeit mostly forgettable. (If you read my other reviews you will note that I tend to remember everything I ordered and the subtle nuances thereof)

I'd take a pass on Haus Murphy's, and that's sad, because they have a cute little biergarten and I like to support independent restaurateurs- a dying breed. 

Sigh.
I love Haus Murphy,  the Brie wrapped in puff pastry and served with berry sauce is delish. Always a pleasant dining experience.  The Jaeger was awesome!

Went for my first time, I'm of German background. The food is first class authentic German fair! All the way from the establishment itself to the staff to the food. 1st class, can't say enough! I will be a regular from now on. I even inquired about a dish I have longed for that wasn't on the menu! Our server can back with a business card and said on my next visit call ahead, they would be happy to prepare it for me . Now that's service! Hope your thirsty as well! BIG BEERS!! .

Haus Murphy's is A-OK in my book!  I've been here twice now and have had fun both times.  

The first time our group of four walked in the front entrance we thought we were in the wrong place.  There was no bar area in sight and who are we kidding, we were there to drink!.  The kind staff member let us know the bar area was down the long hallway, past the bathrooms.  Ah-ha, that is more what we were expecting.  There is also a nice patio area on the side that allows for direct access to the bar area.

Speaking of the bar, the boots of beer are a great picture opportunity.  I'm not sure who the model was for the boot, but that person had some very round calf muscles and very tiny ankles.  Also, when the beer in the boot gets low, drink with the toes to the side so that it doesn't bubble up in your face while you're drinking.

The appetizers are great to split with a big group.  The Sausage Sampler is one of my favorites for snacking; served with sauerkraut and mustard . . . YUM!  Other good choices include the stuffed mushrooms and soft pretzel.

Also, for you 24 fans, I think that Jack Bauer's older brother works behind the bar.  Nice guy!

3 stars for food
4 stars for everything else

We wanted to try something new and so we decided to try this place.  First of all, I love the fact that they have plenty of free parking; even on a Sat night.  The restaurant is actually much larger than I thought with the huge back room where we were seated.  

Since it is a German restaurant, we were ready to try their beer but didn't have a clue as to which one...our waitress took delivery of bringing us samples to see which one we favor.  That was very nice of her.  After ordering the beer, we had the imported pretzel, Paprika Schnitzel, Sauerbraten.  

*Pretzel = YUM!  It was crusty on the outside and very chewy inside.
*Paprika Schnitzel = very much like Japanese cutlet.  Not as flavorful..
*Sauerbraten = we tried it because we heard that it takes 4 days.  Honestly, the only thing we could taste was the thick sauce, the meat was kinda tough, and the pasta was bland.  On the upside, I liked the red cabbage.

Overall, it was a great experience with live German music, great beer and pretzel.  
But would we go back?...probably not.

*Ambiance = Wonderful!  It doesn't really feel like AZ.
*Food = mediocre...we prefer more flavor
*Area = good.  in the middle of old town Glendale.
*Service = great.  we had a wonderful waitress who took very good care of us.

Really wanted to go to Haus Murphy's for quite awhile.. Attempted 3X this week.. Today was the day.  I'm The hostess was short, direct and to the point.. not very pleasant. The potato cake were outstanding , baked bri was also really good. The sausage sampler tasted old couldn't even get it down. Haus goulash tasted like Dinty Moore beef stew. The bathroom needed cleaning, the rug runner that in the dining area looked so dirty it needs to be replaced  at least a year overdue. The beer was awesome.

Great food, service not so much! Let me first say that we had a large group and one server  was definitely not enough but Patrick gave it a great effort. On the other hand we did call in a reservation so perhaps a bit more preparation on their part would have been helpful so all of us might  have been served and waited upon in a more timely manner. Also, I didn't know it went against protocol to turn around and ask the bar tender whom was not busy to refill a soda. I guess it was since I was told that was my server's job and he would get it, apprarently if he was I woudn't be asking the bar, enough said.
It was my first time at Haus Murphy and one of the best things about going with a big group is friends share. I ordered the Kilometer sausages, with fried potatoes and sauerkraut. The sausages were Hungarian, great flavor and so big they hung off the sides of the plate. I've never liked sauerkraut growing up but theirs I liked. My food was excellent and back to the friends and sharing, we exchanged bites, sausage for schnitzel, I tried a few, and every bite was amazing! I was getting quite full but since it's quite some distance from where I lived I figured I better try dessert. Oh bread pudding would have made the evening, but unfortunately for me but probably fortunately for my waistline they had just ran out. 
I'd go back again, the food is definitely worth coming back for!

We tried this establishment for my late birthday celebration based on the reviews of previous Yelpers. What a find!!! This restaurant is located in the Glendale historical district. The parking can be a little tight; you can park at a few close parking lots - it's a short walk. 

They have an outdoor seating area that looks fairly European. The atmosphere indoors is full of German cultural decorations as well. They even host Polka music on the weekends!

The wait staff was awesome and extremely friendly, efficient and knowledgeable. They have a terrific menu! We had one of their pretzels with cheese as an appetizer - it was huge! It took up the entire plate! You could split one of their pretzels between 3 to 4 people easy.

They serve authentic German beer, wine and cocktails along with a fantastic desert menu for after dinner.

I will definitely return for some authentic German cuisine and beer the next time we visit the Glendale area! A solid 5 stars!!!

Delicious German-fare. Living in Glendale has its perks, Glendale Square is home of Haus Murphy. The food is delicious and the ambiance is fantastic. You never know when a live band playing the polka is in the house. Try the schnitzels. They are all great. My favorite is the Paprika Schnitzel. They have a lovely warm kraut that they serve with the meal. For an appetizer, the Brie en Croute is divine served with a fabulous Lingenberry sauce. Try convincing your wait staff to give you extra Lingenberry sauce. If you are in to German sausages, they are delicious but a little on the pricey side. Of course, the beers are fantastic and robust. I love their Oktoberfest. Warning, this restaurant does not offer free bread. If you order the bread basket, while delicious, it is a small portion, so if you are a bread lover, you might have to order more than one basket and pay for it, too. Sometimes, they serve a beef broth soup that is to die for. Don't let looks deceive you. It doesn't look like much, but the flavors are robust and well-layered.

One word, INCREDIBLE!!!! That describes everything i have tried at Haus Murphy's. If you want to experience complete bliss then try the gnocchi, theres is really fantastic. Its definitely the best i have ever had. Also, there sausage is great and (I cant believe im saying this because I am someone who used to hate it but) There sauerkraut is amazing. I couldn't stop eating it.
   The place has a very nice historic feel to it which adds to the experience. They have a nice outdoor seating area and some nights they have a band that plays out there. 
    Just try Haus Murphy's, I know you wont be disappointed.

Not at all impressed; they had some "live" entertainment that was too loud; place was hot, and was told, well, its an old building and it is August, so it gets warm; not a good answer; food was mediocre at best; I've had way better...and the prices were high for some items; 7.50 for potato pancakes? really? Went for a friends birthday, but won't go back again....

My husband & I were excited to try this place, especially since my husband spent 4 yrs in Germany.  He always raved about how wonderful Jäger Schnitzel is.  

We decided to go on a Saturday, for lunch.  Because reservations are recommended, we called and asked if they had anything for around 1:30 (it was 12:00 when we called).  They said "no problem."  When we arrived at about 1:10, we noticed there were only 3 tables with patrons.  They seated us right away.  First impression was that the entire restaurant needs a MAJOR redo and update on the decor!  The carpet was filthy, and as we passed all the varied & different  pictures (tons), I couldn't help but noticed how much dust lay on the frames.

The staff was attentive.  We were brought our drinks & water very quickly.  Although I had to have them take my water back because there was lettuce floating in the water.  

When my new water & glass (?) returned lettuce-free, we ordered.  My husband, as expected, ordered the Jäger Schnitzel.  I decided to try something I'd never had & ordered Beef Gulasch (roughly translated: Beef Goulash).  

Our food arrived in about 20 minutes.  First thing we noticed was how small the Schnitzel portion was.  Wasn't much bigger than my husbands palm. After my husband took his first bite, I could tell he wasn't impressed.  I tried it also.  The breading was not crispy & it tasted like unflavored panko bread crumbs.  The Wild Mushroom Demi that was on top was really salty.  As was the green cabage that came as one of the sides.

My Gulasch was served in a bowl, which was appropriate.  I was expecting  some vegetables or pasta in the bowl, not just meat and a couple mushrooms.  The gravy tasted like jarred brown gravy with a few sauteed mushrooms thrown in.  My husband suggested mixing the meat & gravy with the pasta that came on the side called Schwäbische Spätzle.  Sounded like a good idea since the noodles were extremely dry.  Once I mixed the two together, it still wasn't that good.

Our final impression?  Just barely ok!  The restaurant interior is old and weary looking.  The food portions were small.  The food taste was either very bland or too salty.  The temp of the food was lukewarm.  All in all, this restaurant was nothing special, and certainly nothing about the food or atmosphere would make us go back!

First time visitor.  The four if us ordered four different things.  It was all wonderful.  The tomato soup at the beginning was so so for me but everyone else loved it.  The portions were huge but I wouldn't have wanted to share.  Will be going again.

El día 8 de diciembre del 2015, en mi negocio decidimos comprar algo diferente de lo común entonces fuimos a este gran restaurante a pedir algo diferente, y una gran sorpresa la comida que nos vendieron estuvo exquisita, con un gran trato, me sentí confortable, y sobre todo, la generosidad, humildad y de esta gran persona, ROSE HOFFMANN, UNA GRAN PERSONA, EXELENTE  SERVICIO.....

It's hard to find a German restaurant these days, so when we found this place on a recent vacation to Scottsdale, we were thrilled.

The food is terrific.  My husband had the goulash, and pronounced it excellent.  He is German, so that means more than from most people - he knows what it should taste like!

The only reason I didn't give it five stars is that the only healthy options (the two sandwiches with ham/pear or turkey/apple) were not available the day we were there.  This is not a place to try to find healthy eating options!

But the grilled Reuben was excellent, with a ton of meat.  Great fries, too!

Definitely recommend this restaurant!

Only visited for a nice cold German beer, but found the place to be very pleasant and relaxing. Selection was excellent. Pretzels were also very good. Very nice outdoor patio for nice weather. I will be back.

Excellent food! We sat outside and enjoyed the atmosphere, plenty of shade and it wasn't too hot. I had the paprika schnitzel that was featured on the food network and my girlfriend had the smoked sausage and sourkrout. Also, I'm not a beer guy, but their German beer was pretty good! All in all I'd definitely recommend this place, even our waiter was German. My only complaint is they didn't have even a small selection of domestic beers.

Wasn't particularly looking for German food yesterday when I was in downtown Glendale. But we found this place and BAM!  What a treat!  

I had a turkey and apple sandwich which was a fantastic choice for a 110° afternoon in Arizona!  Light. Refreshing. And a surprising blast of flavors. 

We also had the classic Ruben. My guest said "the best Ruben" she's had "since the last time" she was "in New York City". So. That's something!

Both came with fries which were great, in my opinion. Excellent seasoning. 

I will be back to try some of their other authentic German dishes. 

Solid 4 stars!

Took my parents here twice and my hubby and I keep going back. Mom is German and she loves how everything has tasted so far. We tried the chocolate cake that is made with sauerkraut juice and oh my gosh, I need the recipe! Not a big fan of chocolate but this was oh so darn scrumptious! Thank goodness there were 4 sharing it though. Lol. Gosh, the potatoes are so relish too. Well, really, what isn't good that I have eaten there yet! Hahahah 

The waitress' have been really nice and the cleanliness of the restaurant has been well maintained. Great location!

We will definitely be back!

Came here for dinner yesterday night. It was quite a quiet night...most shops were already closed on the street and it was only 7pm. The restaurant was nicely lit so it wasn't hard to find.

We tried the Bauernplatte - Combo for two. So basically it has a little bit of everything on the menu...pretty good choice if you want to try everything they serve in one sitting. hehe 

So the combo plate included three types of bratwurst, pork schnitzel (which is a flat piece of pork, breaded and fried), kassler kotelett ( which is porkchop), German fried potatoes, German potato salad, red cabbage and sauerkraut. I liked all three types of bratwurst, but the most tasty of them all is the kassler kotelett. This pork chop is very different from any kind of pork chop I have had...usually pork chops are pretty rough and not very flavorful...but this pork chop is very moist and flavorful...sorta taste like ham. This was my bf and my favorite out of the sampler. The pork schnitzel wasn't that good because there was no sauce and it was a bit bland. I wasn't a fan of the potato salad because it was sour...not a fan of the red cabbage or the sauerkraut but the German fried potatoes were tasty. 

The beer according to my bf has a different taste and is slightly stronger than American beer. 

The service was really good - - the waitress was very friendly and sweet.

Overall, I liked the food, atmosphere and service. =]

This place is amazing. 
I am by no means a German Food critic - nor do I know what German food is "supposed" to taste like, but hopefully this is it, because it's amazing.  My husband was stationed in Germany for 6 Years, and he loves it... so I trust his opinion. 

I love the beer, I love the spatzel, I LOVE the snitzel. 

I bring everyone to Haus Murphy I can, because everything is amazing. 
A few times, I brought my parents and there was a polka bang being amazing in the bar area. 

I love this resturant.

My glutOny and my lack of knowledge abOut the american measure system will kill me!
But at least i'm trying the gOod and special plates anywhere.
I wanted to grab a beer on a terrasse to review aome touristic information abOut Glendale, and i finished with a 32 oz grape fruit beer and a giant bretzel!

Both of it succulent.
The grapefruit beer was really perfumed and fresh while the bretZel was perfectly baked and sized for me.

It seems that the place hosted Oktoberfest and i believe it did it perfectly!

Just where is the austrian blonde in her folkloric dress!!!???

I was really excited to try this place because my boyfriends family loves eating here. I thought it was just okay.

The heavily decorated interior was a bit much for my taste and the loud music made it hard to talk to one another. Our table and menus had that "sticky diner feel". 

We ordered the giant pretzel with cheese sauce and that was the best part of the meal by far. For dinner I ordered the weiner schnitzel and it was bland and overly greasy. It came with a side of fried German potatoes that were also coated in grease and flavorless. However I will give credit to their sausage. My boyfriend ordered the kilometer and that was phenomenal. I regret not getting the chocolate cake everyone raves about because it looked incredible.  

The staff was great and id give them 5 stars for customer service. Id come back to try more of their sausage options just to give it another chance. Maybe German food just isn't for me.

It was so good! My family and I made reservation for 7:15 on a Saturday night. We arrived a few minutes early but we were seated right away. We ordered a couple of the liter beers and an appetizer to start, the stuffed mushrooms which were on point! Especially with the cream sauce( ask for extra) my Fiancé and I ordered the Jagersnitzschel plus added spatzle, potato dumpling, and sauerkraut. Make sure to get extra sauce for everything. Everything was delicious except for the spatzle which could have used a thicker gravy sauce as well as the potato dumpling. I was stationed in Germany awhile back so I think I might know a thing or two... Everything was pretty authentic but I think they need to make the gravy thicker and with a little more flavor. Other than that it was delicious and we will be back to try other things. The Sauer kraut was some of the best we have ever had. Our server was very nice and attentive her name was Angela. The ambiance was great too, we really liked the live music.

Greatest German Food in Arizona.

I feel a little jet lagged, I've just come from Germany, but no jet lag here, I was eating at Haus Murphy in Downtown Glendale and thought I was in Germany. 

Great place, don't miss eating here, or you will miss a real treat.
Quick service, excellent food. Thanks for reminding me on Facebook that we needed schnitzel. It was great.

Personally, I felt like the food was not that great. My chicken was dry and the sauce was too cheesy. So if you're into cheesy stuff then I guess you'll like the mushroom sauce over the chicken. The potatoes was honestly very soggy and gross. As for the sauerkraut, it was so nasty. The taste didn't even taste like sauerkraut... I don't know what it was honestly.. I'm disappointed with the food here. 

The service was not that great either. Our waitress was very straight forward. I asked for more crackers and she literally threw it on the table without saying anything. She was very slow and not that attentive. 

I would come back again but I probably get something different to try.... Maybe their pretzel cause it looked really good.

Not a fan anymore! 3 stars for the fantastic Pretzels. Took my husband for his Birthday per his request. We have celebrate multiple birthdays here. It was dead quiet and the waitress refused to sing Happy Birthday in German. Time to find another place.

Worst service ever for October Fest. Asked server 3 times for our drink and waited an hour. Finally had to go to bar to get beer. Food took forever & came out all wrong. Their excuses we are really busy tonight and our kitchen has a default for your food. WHAT????

Went for Oktoberfest and had a great time!  We had to go to the bar to get our mixed drinks since they would not bring them to the table, only beer.. but that was our only complaint.  The waitress was always on spot with help and food even with such a heavy load with all the people there and we had a table of 16.
Haus Murphy has really gone down hill...it used to be amazing...now sadly it is average.

Walked into this restaurant on a Friday night around 7pm without reservations, and were seated right away.  The inside was packed because of the heat outside.  There is an inside and outside area to dine.  We decided to eat indoors.  We ordered the sausage Sampler at $10, and were surprised at the size of the sampler, nice size.  There was around 3 or 4 sausages on a huge bed of sauerkraut. Since we ordered the sausages for an app. I decided to try the Goulash Meal with Spaetzle, and Sauerkraut at $14.  My husband tried a combo with some sort of pork, with German potatoes and another helping of sauerkraut at $16.  My dish was a good size and the Goulash was really good, lots of gravy.   My husband's pork was nice and tender, almost melted in his mouth.  It took awhile for us to get our meal, we ordered a couple of beers while waiting.  During our dinner live polka musicians were playing.  It was nice to get some German ambiance in phoenix.  Beers were warm, but that's what was expected. For two of us to eat, with app, and two beers our dinner was about $75 with tip.  It was also hot in the restaurant.  They have plastic over the seats and it was a warm night and we sat right by the windows, so it was a little uncomfortable.   Both my husband and I were sweating, so we didn't want to sit around after our meal.  The food was good though.

Awful service.  Waited 30 minutes for for our beers.  Then waited another 30 morning mutes to take our order then 20 minutes later was told they were out of chicken.   When delivered the server got snotty with us when HE placed the wrong plates down.  

No apology.  No compensation.  .zero service recovery.

Really a pretty good place to have some good German Food. Good beer selection and fun atmosphere. Love their schnitzel and potatoes! Only reason this isn't a 5 Star - is the service is a bit uneven and the cake (black Forrest cherry) goes from awesome to styrofoam - you never know if it's gonna be great one time and completely dried out the next. Still fun and pretty yummy.

My husband has wanted to go here for ages. 


The server was so, so sweet. 
The accordion player added atmosphere 
The raspberry center of the torte was yummy
The gravy on the pork tenderloin schnitzel was excellent 
The pork tenderloin schnitzel was excellent, not heavy or greasy

The beef roulade was okay 

The lemon raspberry torte was heavy, lacked a lemon taste.  What I ate was the raspberry Center which was only on the bottom layer. This should have been on both layers.  The cream was a bit overwhelming

The tap water that was served had an extremely hard water taste. There was no other water available to purchase.

I was mistaken in my previous review. This place is honestly delicious. Maybe the kitchen was just having an off night the first time I went? Who knows, but if you order the steak schnitzel you can't go wrong. The wait staff is very friendly but unfortunately that doesn't seem to be mirrored by the management.

I've wanted to try this place for almost 2 years now but I don't get to the west valley too much.  Today we celebrated a friend's graduation and he wanted to come here.  What an awesome place.  Very nice and spacious with a beer garden outside with a stage and the inside feels very homey.  We came on a Thursday around 2:30 and we got seated immediately.  We started out with their Original Oktoberfest Pretzel to share.  Man was that good.  Served with a side of cheese and their house made spicy mustard.  I could eat 3 of those they were that good.

For lunch I tried the Schweizer Schnitzel.  It's a pork tenderloin fried golden brown with black forest ham and swiss cheese on top.  It is served with a side of German potatoes  and Wirsing.  I've never had Wirsing.  It was cooked cabbage with bacon and herb cream cheese.  I'm not a fan of cooked cabbage and let me say I could eat a plate of Wirsing.  The whole meal was fabulous and our waitress was excellent.  I saw this restaurant featured on Triple D and I knew I had to try it.  I will be back to Haus Murphy's.  It's a long drive from where I live but worth it.  A great place to have authentic German food done right and with a great atmosphere to boot.

Before my last visit, I would have given this place a positive review, but after my last visit, I will never be returning. We were sitting there for an hour while people who came in long after we did were getting their food. The manager came out and told us that they had lost our order. We received a lukewarm apology at best, and all we got for our troubles was a free bread basket. No comps, no discount, nothing. Congratulations, Haus Murphy. You have successfully guaranteed that a lover of German food will NEVER return! Goodbye, and good riddance!
Great locally owned authentic German restaurant. I love the biers available on tap and their schnitzels.

Good food, but overpriced. I've been to Germany on numerous occasions, and when i told my German friends how much the bill came to ($98 for 2 people), the reply was that someone from the restaurant should have came home with us to do some housework. 

I'd go back for the beer, but I'd eat somewhere else 1st.

I've been to Haus Murphy's twice now (once for my birthday, once for the World Cup finals), and both times were incredible! I have a lot of Germany heritage, and grew up in a VERY German area of Pennsylvania. When I got to Phoenix I searched high and low for German restaurants and this is the only authentic one I could find, and it does not disappoint.

The Service:
Service has been great both times. Staff is very courteous, and the first time we went our waiter gave us the full history of the restaurant and explanation of German food, traditions, etc. He grew up in Germany and had awesome stories to tell.

The Food:
I admittedly ordered the same thing both times I went: Weinerschnitzel. It was too good not to order again! The schnitzel itself is always lightly breaded and fried, just like it should be. It comes with German fried potatoes and Wirsing (a chopped, creamy savoy cabbage side dish that is nearly impossible to find in most restaurants). Both are delicious. Also the portions of everything are huge!
My guests ordered the "Schweizer Schnitzel," "Huhner Scnitzel," "The BIG Smokey Beef Brat," "Nurnberger Bratwurstchen," and "Rote Bratwurst." All the brats were very tasty, and most come with homemade sauerkraut (by far the best sauerkraut I've ever had -- my wife who usually refuses to eat it enjoyed theirs).
As far as appetizers go you also can't go wrong with the Potato Pancakes or Oktoberfest Pretzel (HUGE - big enough for 3 or 4 people).

Price:
Haus Murphy's is on the pricier side ($19.95 for the Weinerschnitzel), but that's really pretty typical for good Weinerschnitzel, and the portions are so large that you can make it into two meals. All the brat meals were $10-$11 and they have a good variety of sandwiches that are around $8-$10 which is good if you're on a tighter budget.

The Decor: 
Very unique and eclectic German decor. Lots of interesting "knick-knacks," paintings, etc. Many of the waitresses dress in Lederhosen which adds a nice touch.

Wunderbar:
Haus Murphy's has a bar/lounge in the back called Wunderbar. We came here to watch the Germany v. Argentina World Cup finals and it was an awesome experience. Tons of screaming German fans all packed into a room lined with German flags and beer steins. It felt like we were in another country. They also have a ton of German beers on tap (including Stofferhoffer -- one of my all time favorites).

Overall, great food, great atmosphere, I HIGHLY recommend it! Excited to come back when they have live music and polka!

I have been here a few times and went out with wife and parents for a pre Valentines day get together.  I was not disappointed.  The food is wonderful and very authentic.  The atmosphere is amazing and the place is filled to the brim, make a reservation.  I love this place and would recommend it to anyone.

FYI Haus Murphy's is generally packed so a reservation is helpful but not necessary.  Also it is not as cheap as a trip to Chili's, so be prepared to spend $35 and up if you want the full experience, obviously more if you are going to have drinks.

My recommendation is to try something new off the appetizer menu when you go!

My friend and I were out for a girl's afternoon out and wanted to try something different for lunch.  We decided on Haus Murphy's.  Being a fan of DDD, we thought we were in for a real treat--so wrong.  The cheese spread appetizer was good and that's where it ended.  We ordered the combo plate for two.  First of all, the food was warm at best;  bad sign.  The portions on the platter were rather skimpy not to mention tasteless.  Guy, we think you got this one wrong!

Poor at best. Slow service. The sides were dry and flavorless--even the sauerkraut. The only reason the place is still in business is that it is the only German restaurant on the west side of the valley.

Very fun, lively, authentic German restaurant.  Our waiter, Johann, really made us feel like he just got in from Germany.  He was probably from Iowa or something silly but he did a great job of making us comfortable and being in the moment.  Everyone loved their selections, espeically my wiener schnitzel w/spaetzle.  And the ice cold German beer selections were great.

We went a long way to try this restaurant and was disappointed, it was not great for sure we tried the platter for two with everything on it!!!  We went to Helga's in Aurora Colorado so many times I lost count, it was wonderful, always fresh made but here it tasted like we were eating leftovers warmed up out of the fridge!! The waiter and service was great only wish the food was!!!

First time visit. Went to see the Christmas lights in downtown Glendale. Heated patio, large beer hall / sports bar atmosphere, authentic German food. Party of four, early dinner at 5pm. Filled up fast. Good service. Recommend the pork schnitzel, kraut and potato meal. Winter menu is edited down. A fun experience, walk off the beer looking at the lights and maybe visit the Cerreta candy a few blocks down.

Been here a couple of times and decided to go again last night.  I've always found it odd that there are so few German spots in the Phoenix area (much less good ones).  It would seem odd that Downtown Glendale of all places would lay claim to the best German spot in the Phoenix area, but having sampled many of the few others in town that exist, its hard to deny that Haus Murphy's has the goods.  Whether you're here for sausages and schnitzels, a good German beer, the feel of a nice outdoor biergarten, or the weekend polka music, you really can't go wrong here.  Just be warned that no matter what you order, the portions will be enormous.  And you'll be hard pressed to find any dishes that have vegetables.  And you'll be even harder pressed to find dishes that don't have meat and potatoes.  Fortunately I'm a meat and potatoes guy and highly recommend each and every one of their sausage dishes.  

My only complaint in the times I've been here is that the service can be a little slow.  On Friday and Saturday nights when the place is packed and the polka band is playing that can be expected, but even when I've come on random lunch and early dinner hours when the place is slower, the service is still pretty slow.  So be sure to plan on spending some time here (I'm pretty sure that's their goal anyway).  As long as you're not in a big hurry and have a hearty appetite, you won't be disappointed.
Very good restaurant. We had a group of 32 and were seated immediately the food was delicious and the service was fantastic. We had the roulanden which was amazing.

I had a really good time, but sometimes I think your experience at a restaurant is much better due to the company.  I really enjoyed our gigantic table.  It created a little bit of havoc for the server and it made service a little slow, but I will cut them some slack.  I ordered the pretzel, because I am a carb addict.  I was so happy we had such a big group, because after cutting a piece I could pass it around to share and not feel so guilty.  It was big enough that about 10 people were able to taste it.  I really liked it.  The spicy mustard was indeed spicy. Before our dinners we got split pea soup, it was very tasty, I am usually not a soup person, but I was hungry and I enjoyed it very much.  For my entree I ordered the Wiener Schitzel, I had not had baby cow in a long time, it was well worth it.  I ate only have of it and took home the rest.  It came with potatoes and wirsing.   The potatoes were very good, on the other hand, I personally didn't like the wirsing (a creamy cabbage concoction).  Good thing Amy liked it, lol. We ordered dessert, but they were taking so long that we asked to have our Black Forest cake and Cherry Strudel to go.  When I got home, I was trying to be so good and got only a third of the strudel, then gave my hubby a third and put the rest in the fridge.  Well that freaking strudel was amazing, I went back to the fridge and ate the rest.  The next day I went twice to the gym.
Great meal i had the chicken schnitzel and the best apple strudel ever. Good atmosphere great service.
Great food and a fun band playing on the patio - love this place!

Love the food here. Huge portions and great service. Must try the sauerkraut potato puffs - even if you're hesitant... they're amazing! I've had schnitzels and sausage and many different appetizers and I haven't been disappointed!

Wife wanted to celebrate the completion of a long term goal and a local friend suggested this place.  However, due to the cold snap we decided upon pho but couldn't locate the place and realized we were right across the corner from Haus Murpheys and decided to pay it a visit instead.

I will start with a disclaimer stating that I have no idea what good german food is or should taste like.

Really loved our dining experience here.  Deduct one star for the slow service.  But in our servers defense, she was helping out in two separate rooms and seemed a little over taxed.
We started with the stuffed mushrooms and was delighted with the taste of the spicy sausage that came through.  Good enough that I could have just eaten a few plates of these for the entire meal.
For the main course we split the Bauernplatte platter which ended up being more than we could handle.  So lets talk meat.  The brauts were great, rote being the better of the two imo, since the german one seemed a bit lacking in flavor.  The Hackbraten, aka meatloaf, was really good and pared well with the spicy mustard.  Next up was the Kassler, which was basically a thick ass ham steak.  It's pork, so, Awesome!  The final slab of meat was the schnitzel which I was surprised with how much I liked it.  Reason was that it was quite rare, which I wasn't sure if it should be or not but it made the texture very delicate and almost melted.
For the non-meat items, the german potatoes were the best.  If only breakfast places could serve potatoes like this!  The regular sauerkraut had good flavor but was too soft for my taste.  The red sauerkraut didn't appeal to me at all.  Least liked was the spatzle.  I just don't get it.  Just little noodles of blah.   
As if this wasn't enough to bring about a food coma, we followed it up with the sauerkraut cake since this is what our friend insisted we should try if we visit.  Chocolate nirvana.  I can only handle small amounts of rich chocolate so only had a few bites but it was seriously good stuff.
Oh, and the beer.  Not much of a german beer fan since I'm into IPAs but the big ass stein of Octoberfest was pretty decent.
Overall, a very enjoyable night out and one I'd certainly be willing to repeat again if we are in the neighborhood again.

We have been here many times over the years and the food is consistently good. Last night we took an out of town visitor there for dinner to enjoy the beautiful AZ weather by sitting outside and have a few beers. They had their Oktoberfest menu which is about 8 entree options from their regular menu and 2 appetizer options. They didn't budge from this because when I asked for a side of spätzle I was shot down. Despite it not being packed they were also serving dinner on plastic plates because of the crowds we were told. We walked in at 6:45 on 
A Saturday night and were seated immediately so that argument didn't really hold up with me but I didn't let it bother me.

I had the chicken schnitzel which was delicious! My husband had the paprika schnitzel and our guest the German bratwurst. A couple rounds of Spaten put a smile on everyone's face. We should have ordered the pretzel appetizer but we were smart and passed because there was no way we could have eaten that and managed to finish the huge portions they serve for the entrees.

The restaurant itself inside could use some freshening up but if you go when the weather is nice you can sit outside and not worry about it.

After viewing this on Diner's Drive-ins and Dives, we have been wanting to go there ever since, but we live on the other side of town.  So when we had an opportunity to go there, I was thrilled.  We ordered the Reuben and Potato Pancakes to share.  The corned beef so so mouthwatering, I could have just eaten that alone; however, the bread needed to be toasted a little more because it fell apart easily.  I didn't care because it was really tasty.  The potato pancakes were a little larger than my gram used to make, and they were made with onions, but I enjoyed them.  The plate was larger than I expected for an appetizer (not complaining at all), but hated to waste any.  It was served with applesauce and sour cream.  I wish I could have enjoyed the beers there, as they looked good.  I would go back.  Service was fine, no complaints.

My family and I are very large fans of German food. And have been to Germany. So when Haus Murphy's popped up on Yelp I knew we had to try it. On our visit we had the Haux (Braised Pork Shank), Sausage Platters, Large Pretzel, and of course lots and lots of Hefeweizen! Overall I thought that Haus Murphys was pretty decent. The Haux was flavorful although I would have liked it a bit warmer. The sausage was flavorful as well. Overall I would go back to Haus Murphys for sure if in the Glendale AZ area.

My hubby and I have dine here several times.  We always have great service and a great tasting meal.  The portions are huge.  I like the pork shank, it doesn't even fit on the plate, really tasty. Hubby loves the different type of links. great atmosphere.

My wife and I and our two son have for years gone to Haus Murphy for Christmas Eve dinner.  We all have lived in Germany for an extended time and a German dinner for our family and our son's wive and girlfriend so a Christmas eve German dinner has become a tradition.  The year before last the woman who runs the place didn't treat us very well (a party of 6).  We tried again last year and they treated us even more shamefully.  We all decided that our experience with Haus Murphy has come to an end.  It's a shame but each time, the woman has pushed us impatiently to finish and we'd made reservations for 7:00 but none the less the lady did everything but put our order in a box and shove us out the door.  Even something as simple as bread with dinner was with held.
Perhaps any other time of the year but not on Christmas eve.  If they don't want customers on the 24th, they should just close for the day.

The sausage/bratwurst at Haus Murphy's is great.  Very flavorful, but I am more fond of the Krakaur (sp?) brat than the others. 

The sausage appetizer is definitely great for a big group and comes with a mustard that is excellent.

Our german waiter was a nice touch. :)

We sat in the lounge area which is nicely decorated and the bar looks great.  The tables being put together is pretty cool, although I kind of wished they were the same type/size so that you didn't feel like the puzzle pieces didn't match.  But that may be my OCD talking.

The food did take a while to cook.  I didn't get a chance to try the schnitzel, but one day I will.  Meanwhile I had the German Brat, which was moist and flavorful.  It was on top of the saurkraut... which having been a child who hated saurkraut, I tried it yesterday for the first time since, and I liked it.  So kudos to them for changing my view of saurkraut.  Unfortunately, my diet currently limits any starches, so I was unable to try the potatos that came with it, but they sure smelled good and looked seasoned appropriately.

The german beer was AWESOME coming in these HUGE mugs... all I needed was one beer.

Price wasn't too bad either.  $34 for a German Brat plate, Krakaur (sp?) brat plate, a side salad, and two german beers.

We would definitely go back.

Great environment but absolutely atrocious service and ok stuffed mushrooms appetizer. We waited for 30 for a table and ordered right when we seat down. After an hour the only thing we received was our appetizer. 5 mins after we seat the table next to us seat and received AND finished food within the hour waiting time for us.  The waitress stated they got their food first bcz they didn't ordered any appetizer. I must be wearing my "I'm stupid" sign. Thanks for ruining date night.

didnt think the food was all that great despite what everyone has been telling me.

go the chicken schniztel and it came out looking like fried country steak with a thick cream mushroom sauce.  the only thing i liked was the potato salad which was not made from mayo but from vinegar and bacon.  

music was loud and lively...dont think ill go back but can see how it can be a good hangout place downing a couple of beers...

Still a fan!  I love their potatoes.  We tried the platter for 2 - 3 different sausages, fried pork chop and pork shank, red cabbage and sauerkraut.  Also some noodley things I didn't really care for..  Everything else though is awesome!

Some good German brews on tap, though known for some tasty wines and fun cocktails they mix.

They have great sausages, decent German style food, not overly extravagant, though table service was excellent. Price was as I'd expect it to be. Wifey and I got the dinner for 2 for $35, I kicked back two Dunkel's and she had a delicious white wine. For desert we opted for the cake and coffees. 

You can opt to sit at the bar, a table, or outside depending on weather and events going on (or lack thereof). 

Clean bathrooms. Plentiful parking around the back sides of the building. It has a homey kind of atmosphere, you are among friends and relax, kudos there.

All in all a nice treat - I'd surely return and explore more of their menu and drinks! As for the authenticity of it being German, well that's like trying to describe American food, you will get something different depending on what region you are in -- it was German enough for me ;)
Great service and fun atmosphere.  If you like German Cuisine, this is a fun place to be with authentic food.  The giant pretzel is a hit with the kiddo's
Had a great time here.  Great food, excellent beer, and live polka!  Be sure to get the sausage and pretzel appetizers.

I've heard so many awesome things about this place & we finally decided to go try it out.  We were seated right away & our server was as sweet as could be! I've never had German food so I went over some Yelp pics while waiting to get an idea of what I wanted.  I ordered the Hühner (chicken) Schnitzel that came with a white wine sauce, I ordered it with the mushroom sauce instead.  My mom got the Jager (pork) Schnitzel.  I also ordered french fries on the side because I had been craving fries alllll day.  Our food took a bit to come out but it was okay, it gave us time to admire all of the cute decor.  My schnitzel was just on the warm side when it came out & wasn't crispy which I was expecting it to be. It was just more of a soft piece of chicken with soft breading.  It came with the white wine sauce even though I asked for a different one, our server apologized & brought me a side of the mushroom sauce.  It was already too late since my chicken came with the sauce all over it to begin with.  Oh well.  The flavor was pretty good, I was just really looking forward to the chicken being crispy.  Is schnitzel supposed to be crispy? I'm not sure, but I'll give it another try.
One of favorite German restaurants!  We make a special trip out there and always go during Glendale glitters.

Stopped by on a whim to try a beer and check out this place and was very pleasantly surprised.  Good beers and wine, lovely atmosphere on the patio, and the paprika schnitzel was very tasty! Icing on the cake was listening to the entertaining accordion/ tuba while eating! The only reason I didn't give them a five as we didn't go inside and have a full dinner but we will be back!

Had such a great experience here today for lunch! I got the Oktoberfest Pretzel with cheese and the Reuben with fries. The food and beer were wonderful! I also brought my dog and the staff more than welcomed him. They gave him a bowl of water and a bowl of house made sausage snacks for him! He loved them!! Will definitely be going back!
I go here on my Anniversary. Amazing food, and believe it or not, a great bar too. The bill is about 25$ per person so fancy but not SOO out of the budget. Thanks Haus Murphy!

The food was amazing, can't wait to go back! I grew up on German food and was hesitant that it wouldn't compare to my Oma's cooking, but I wasn't disappointed. Our waitress, Carlene, was so nice and very knowledgeable about the menu! We definitely be back with the whole family.

I know it is difficult to be a vegetarian or a pescatarian at certain restaurants. Haus Murghy's is one of them.

They do have some vegetarian options, but almost all of them were carb-heavy. (I need my protein too!!) Their giant Bavarian pretzel was, er, giant. It was warm and delicious with mustard. Although I am a huge fan of spätzle, the vegetarian version of Farmer Skillet (basically buttered noodles with some veggies) was rather bland compared to the gnocchi smothered in rich Gruyere cheese and wild mushroom sauce.

My dining companions ordered a wedge salad (a wedge of Iceberg lettuce = B-O-R-I-N-G), Caesar salad with grilled chicken (pretty good, so I was told), and bean soup (with hamburger meat).

The service was friendly, but I just wish they had given a bit more thought to fish/veggie options. (Or am I being ridiculous?)

If this is what all German food tastes like, then consider me a fan.

I was in Phoenix to celebrate my birthday with family, and we sort of found our way here by accident.  The decor is very charming -- as though a group of German grandmothers decided to put up every picture frame and knick knack they had -- and the service is prompt and very pleasant.  

For starters, we the pastry-wrapped brie with lingonberry jelly -- a HUGE hit with the family.  The pastry crust was crisp, the brie melty and gooey, and the lingonberry jelly served as the perfect sweet complement to the cheesey, savory flavors.  Even my sister, whom I consider a pretty picky eater, loved it.

For the main course, it was schnitzel all around!  My mom ordered the Schweizer Schnitzel (pork wrapped in Emmentaler cheese and ham), which she really liked, but wished she had ordered a sauce to come with it.  My sister had the Paprika Schnitzel, which was actually a lot sweeter than she had expected, but again, very tasty.  I had the Holstein Schnitzel (fried egg, anchovies, and capers), which was everything I had hoped it would be.  Dad changed things up by ordering the Beef Roulades, which he simply could not stop eating.  I don't even remember him talking while food was on his plate, to be honest.  

I ordered a litre of the Hefeweizen they had on tap in hopes that I'd get the infamous glass boot, but unfortunately they were saving all the boots for the upcoming Oktoberfest, and so I just got a huge regular-shaped glass instead.  I'm not really a big beer drinkers, and so without the novelty of the boot glass, downing that much beer wasn't as much fun as I'd wanted (especially since I was the only one drinking), but I don't fault them for that policy.  I'll just have to go back some other time!  

All in all, a very good, fulfilling meal.  A very cute restaurant nestled in a charming area of old Glendale, Haus Murphys is a refreshing escape.
The patio is very nice. Live music is fun. Been coming for years. Food is good. But everything is incredibly over priced. From the beer to the German bratwurst.

Great German place in downtown Glendale!  The atmosphere was really nice...not sure why they seated us in the bar when everyone else was seated in the front dining room though.  Our server was very helpful in making beer and dinner recommendations.  The food was pretty good too...I had the special kraut rouladen with potatoes and red cabbage.  The beer garden looked like a great place to spend a Saturday afternoon in cooler months and I hear they have a band that plays every Friday and Saturday night which would be fun!

Saturday night is a fun night to go to HausMurphy in downtown Glendale. Get there early before they sellout of the smoked pork chops! 
There was a tuba and accordion player that serenaded us throughout our dinner time. 
Not a lot of gluten-free on the menus unless you count the sausages. Oh and their chicken dumplings soup.
Great portions and tasty German food and bier.;)

I didn't know German food was so delicious!  
The menu is fairly big and thankfully pretty descriptive.  Our party of 6 adults and 1 child all had different things and all very much enjoyed our meals.  I think there is enough variety on the menu for everyone to find something to enjoy.  I was honestly pretty intimidated, figured it would all just be big greasy sausages and sauerkraut.  I was delightfully surprised.  I would recommend the schitzel to those who are just ready to dip their toes in, it's basically just a breaded and fried piece of meat (chicken, pork, beef, whichever).  
Lots of beer and wine pics and a great atmosphere, particularly outside on the patio.

Haus Murphy's is fabulous in so many ways that I can really only hit the highlights here. Even if German food isn't your favorite (I dislike saurkraut and cabbage), the service and food is great.

The service was wonderful. I was almost 2 hours earlier than my friends, so I used a table in the bier garden to do some work on my computer (with my own mobile hotspot. . . Haus Murphy's does not have wi-fi). The entire staff made me feel welcome as a sipped a wonderful German beer and did some work.
