My friends showed up, we had great dinners, and then we continued on to Glendale Glitters. If I'm able to make it over to Glendale from my home in Mesa for Glendale Glows in January, I will certainly stop in Haus Murphy's. 

Authentic German or not (I've never been to Germany, my friends of mine who have seemed to really enjoy the food too), this place is worth the visit. 

Enjoy!
Good sauerkraut, and beef bratwurst. The sauerkraut chocolate cake was fresh and delicious!

Before I give this review I will say I grew up by a very old town Amish German town in the Midwest. 
 I love German food and in Arizona you can count on one hand that you get it here in the valley. I used to go to this place in the early 2000's and it used to be a once a month treat for us poor Airman stationed at Luke. We sat at the bar and service was excellent. I ordered the Sauerbraten and my wife order the Jagerschnitzel. The schnitzel was nicely prepared and gravy was excellent. The Sauerbraten did not seem to have been marinated, or if it was it wasn't marinated for very long. It was very dry and overcooked but the gravy was spot on! The Spätzle was also good just a little under seasoned. Great beer on tap and great ambiance. I don't mind paying for food when it's great, I was just hoping that their featured menu item had a little more quality control.
Good food, great beer.  We have always sat in the Wunderbar area, which is fine but I can't wait to chill on that great patio sometime.

German food, opens about 4 pm. German beer cold ones! Watch their specials sometimes not what you expected. Nice for an new adventure in dining. German decor. Ask the very helpful waiters. Nice restaurant. Be sure not to park in wrong places.you will get ticket.Price higher end . Nice friendly waiters that help you decide. A few American food items.Out door dining in Night evenings.More up scale Two people $50.00 for two to eat w desert too!
Not very impressed.... Very pricey and not good=/ Maybe I just don't have the taste for German food.

I have wanted to eat at Haus Murphy's for years! Finally I was able to check this place out on my last visit to AZ. Although it was featured on Food Network, I was a little disappointed. Come prepared with Tums to naw on after you eat too. I left with the most wicked case of heart burn! I was expecting a more authentic feel to the enviornment and it was lacking. The food was ok, I had the pretzel crusted schnitzel, mashed potatoes, red cabbage and spaetzle. It was a little bland and had a lot of grease! I have had better German food with better ambience and the service was a little to be desired. I am glad I finally went, but I will look elsewhere for German food in the future.

It is as name suggests a German themed bar with all cliches thrown at it including traditional  music in the  evenings and all but it all gels well. It has indoor dining areas as well as patio seating. You can also chose to sit at the bar. The restaurant itself is located in Glendale downtown with plenty of free parking.They have a very nice selection of German beers on tap and they have a great range from blondes to.darks. The staff is friendly and courteous but not overbearing. I had a sausage plate which came with two sausages on a bed of sauerkraut with ketchup and two types of mustard. It was a pretty good meal for dinner. My friend got meatloaf with German take on it but it was just a regular meatloaf (where I took a star away). But overall they have great food and good beer. It is a nice place to spend an evening with family and friends. I would definitely recommend this place.

Let's just say, this is personally my Favorite Restaurant.
Love sharing Haus Murphys with my family & my very close friends.
I might be a little bias, My Mom...Rose, & Chef Brett Hoffmann have created a Landmark of sorts for Glendale Az.  
They're the owners & creators of this little gem of a Restaurant.
I urge everyone to take in what they have both worked at for well over 20 years.  
Take your time & enjoy...Eat, Drink, & make some memories.  

Tell Mom I said, Hi...& that I couldn't be more proud of her,  & I love her.

I freaking love this place. I had never tried German food, nor a bratwurst before my first visit here! Sit outside! The ambiance is perfect, (and unless it's in the middle of summer), the weather is perfect too. I can't ever decide so I usually convince someone to split the two-person sampler with me ($36.50). Which honestly can be split with more than two, depending on your appetite. The employees are dressed in authentic style German clothing. We even had a German server, Michael, who was with great spirits with us even though we stayed 10 minutes after close! If you're on the fence about the pretzel, you must get it (with cheese of course)

The food is basically the same as always, decent but I lived in Germany for 8 yrs and its ok. Spaetzel was bland, no seasoning. I ordered stuffed mushrooms caps, plural, but got a giant portabello stuffed mushroom cap. Server did not advise me on this, and I sent it back. We ask for butter for the bread baske, and got frozen butter, really? The service is sorely lacking servers have no enthusiasm for their job and it carries over to your dining experience. I have been going to Haus Murphy's since 99 off and on I don't think I'll be coming back after our last visit.

After living in Germany for a decade I learned what good German food is. This place does a very good job of recreating a local restaurant in any German neighborhood. The decor is spot on and the waitresses dress were authentic. The beer selection is good,  unfortunately they were out of Pilsner. I enjoyed a very good Hefeweisse. My Jager Schnitzel was very good and high marks for the mushroom gravy. The potatoes were greasy and the cooked cabbage was mushy but tasty.  My cousin had the porkchops which were perfectly done. Her sides were edible but not fantastic. 
They do a great job on the main dishes but the sides were only ok and need improvement. 
Service was excellent. 
I would recommend.

This is the best German food in town we have been to Haus Murphys several times over the last fire years. We even celebrated Christmas here a while back the portions are great. My friend had the Steak Schnitzel I tried a bite and I would almost call it life changing. We also got to enjoy live accordion music in the Biergarten. I had the sampler for one and we split the huge Bavarian pretzel. It was all so good I decided to take a walk around downtown before getting back in the car to go all the way to the other side of town. Always amazing always worth the drive when I have time to go there.

THE place to go for German food in the Valley.  

Excellent schnitzels, plenty of good beer on draft, and a large, comfortable outdoor area.  Very heavy food, but delicious.
Love this place. This time we came for my daughters birthday, service was really good ask for the brie and lingonberry appetizer, it's not on the menu but it's fantastic.

Yes went back with wife and kids again after state fair and listened to a live German band! Kids meals cooked to perfection I got the kilometer which was a killer kiebasa with sauerkraut and German potatoes, holy mackerel was that awesome!!!!!!!

Had a quick lunch here today (alas, didn't try the beer, things to do later...).  Overall, not too bad at all.  

Service was courteous and competent.  Hostess and server alike were warm and pleasant.

Atmosphere was pretty cool.  Walk in through a neat little beer garden/patio area (could see where this place would be great at night) into a very National Lampoon's European Vacation-like decor.  Clean, but not fancy (our bread plates were clearly from two different sets of china (one plain, one with elaborate printing)).  Overall very inviting and comfortable.  Our table was against the window facing Glendale Ave, so one could do some people watching...

Food was solid.  Started with simple potato pancakes w/ apple sauce and sour cream.  They were nicely seasoned and tasty, but probably frozen (nothing wrong with restaurants serving packaged food by the way... as long as it's good).  My wife had the chicken schnitzel which came out crisp-but-not-too-heavy on the outside and moist/tender on the inside.  The mushroom/wine sauce wasn't great, but wasn't horrible either.  I had a Big Griller (a rather phallic-looking footlong bratwurst served over sauerkraut.  It was quite yummy.  Strangely, the menu says "Great with Curry Ketchup", but it didn't come with any nor were we offered...   Just thought it was weird.

The price was very reasonable and overall a pleasant meal.  Not necessarily a place I'd drive to regularly, but if in the area, definitely worth a stop.

Came here on a Saturday evening. I got the meal Guy Fieri tried and the girlfriend got pasta mit vodka. We both enjoyed our meals. This place has a really fun atmosphere and you feel like you are in Germany while dining. Will be back and recommend it to others.

I was soooo excited to hear about a German Restaurant in Arizona. After visiting Berlin and Franfurt for a week, I absolutely fell in love with German food. 
While the service was great and prices were decent, the food was not as exciting as I thought it would be. For an appetizer, we ordered the stuffed mushrooms. This was a great start to the meal because they were great. Possibly the best stuffed mushrooms I have ever had. Cream Sauce was amazing and the shredded sweet potato on top was a nice touch. That, along with my beer, were the best parts of the meal I would say. For dinner I chose the bratwurst with sour kraut and German potato salad, and my husband chose the paprika schnitzel with wersing and German fried potato's. Both of us had the soup of the day as well which was cream of mushroom. The soup was decent although it could have used a bit more salt. My meal was ok but comparing this to similar meals in Germany, I felt it was kinda boring and lacking. Also, the curry ketchup I ordered was not what I expected. Curry Ketchup in Germany is a lot like BBQ sauce in taste. The stuff I got at Haus Murphy's just didn't taste right to me. It tasted like ketchup with a curry aftertaste. Anyways, my husband did not like his paprika schnitzel at all. The flavor also seemed a bit odd. If you don't like curry, do not order this dish! The fried potato's were mediocre (kinda boring). The wursing, on the other hand, was very good. I think its because it had the same cream sauce as what was in the mushrooms. After dinner, we decided on bread pudding for dessert. This dessert definitely needed some work. There was not enough spice in it so it tasty like nothing more than bread soaked in eggs most of the time eating it. In any event, Haus Murphy's wasn't bad. I am rating it based on whether I would continue to go there and since I am in Maricopa and its in Glendale, the food would have to be spectacular to make me want to come back. Unfortunately, only a couple of small portions were close to being spectacular which I am not sure make it worth the time, effort, and money to return again.

Good food and service. The pretzel is home made and very good--We had their meat loaf,pork chops, and Hungarian Sausage and all were very good. We always enjoy eating there before going to Coyote Hockey Games.

First  time  there  read reviews, kind of old has charm but could use little  updating  inside. Server was ok,food was excellent, could put little more  applesauce  with pancakes . We sat inside by windows, sat at one table  then moved all could  use extra care wiping them off. Would  go back but would  leave if still grimy. So please give place some TLC.
A true classic in Glendale. The food is consistently excellent. You can't beat a place that serves beer by the liter.

We came here for lunch one day last week and I did not leave disappointed. We were able to sit outside in the shade, like most of the other lunch diners and the experience was quite enjoyable. My friend and I both ordered the Reuben sandwich and while it was ver-y greasy, still tasty. We topped it off with the chocolate sauerkraut torte and were not sorry. I think they were having Oktoberfest specials, but I do know that the piece of cake we ordered cost about the same as our sandwiches. Lol. Their menu was limited, and again, not sure if it was a special lunch/Oktoberfest thing. 

Our server was friendly enough but was very busy and it seemed like a lifetime between submitting a request and it actually getting accomplished (you know, like getting a straw) 

Great place in downtown Glendale. I'd love a more sour and less sweet sauerkraut, but that's just me. :)
Great atmosphere inside and outside. I love the music on the patio and the relaxed atmosphere and people that go there. Such great comfort food! Good choice if in Glendale!

Can you say schnitzel?

I love the Haus Murphy's.  Their newer location is bigger, so dinning with a group is a breeze now.  The food is awesome.  The sausage is top notch, the sausage  platter is obtuse.  I'm a schnitzel addict, so I always entertain one when I visit.  The Bread Pudding is fantastic, but as is all the dessertery.  It's a German place and the one pasta dish they have there is even killing.  It's a bit expensive, but worth it in every way.  

For the drinkers, it's a little bit of heaven.  They always have about 5 German beers on tap usually Franziskaner WeissBier, Warsteiner Dunkel, Spaten Optimator, A Weistephaner, and a Pilsner of German origin.  I used to hit up the happy hour here on a reg and deplete them on mustard and pretzels.  They also serve beers in the huge mugs if you're a drunk or just like big things.

This place is really good. You have to get a huge german beer and drink it while you eat a schnitzel it is delicious. One of the best restaurant meals I have in a long time. Can't say enough good things. Great food

Ok, what do you get when you cross a cute downtown area, an oom-pah band, and some incredible food and drink? Haus Murphy of course!

Let's keep this simple:
     Sister's birthday, large party sat immediately
     Beautiful outdoor seating
     Unbeatable food - Pretzels!
     Fun selection of beverages
     Great service from a super-cute German waiter


I can't wait to come back!

Went on a Wednesday evening, and the place was pretty empty, especially since all the shops were closed for the night. 2 out of our 4 people had the goulash which was just alright. Oddly sweet for a meaty dish. 1 had the sauerbraten, which we found out was on Triple D, and it was surprisingly "meh" for a purported signature dish. The paprika schnitzel was the best dish by far. Portions were large, but I'm sure you could find better for the price. Having a truly fabulous German restaurant back home in the Chicago suburbs, this was a pale comparison.

Time to get your Polka on ... never thought I 'd wish I knew the moves to the Chicken Dance ..mid westerners help me out!! 
Haus Murphy just was plain ole fun tonight  , thanks to two Polka playing  Hawaiian-shirted, German loving musicians and a table  next to us full of celebrationistos  feeling no pain ,  we really enjoyed our time.  

The beer was flowing all around us , big mugs , giant mugs, lots of mugs.  Our large family group ordered lots of yummy homey foods  like German Meatloaf , which was rich and seasoned and moistened quite well . My husband and I ordered the giganto platter,the Bauernplatte for two was completely  awesome!  A  great eating challenge for my husband who can put away of truckload of food. This platter had a variety of meats including a wonderful chicken schnitzel, German potatoes, red cabbage , brats in assortment  and sauerkraut that tasted nothing like that stuff from a jar. 
We finished off dinner with some moist bread pudding like apple strudel that I thought tasted wonderful . I would love some more right now!!  Low carb diet  be gone!  Beware after such a big meal  1piece of strudel is enough for two people. 
Ambiance is  familyish , lots of people , and very fast service.  They have many long tables that serve big groups well. Looks like they are pros at  having a good time. Haus Murphy is a great place to take a family for fun .

Part of my family is German and let me say this is definitely authentic food! The food is good and the beers are large. Everything is large. When you go, be prepared to take home a lot of food. I ordered the wiener snitzel and when it came I was overwhelmed. It fed me dinner for three nights!

The service was friendly but a bit confused. They didn't ask if we were ready to order, we had to ask to order and then they didn't ask the whole table but went back and forth putting orders in one at a time.

My friend had the kilometre, which was a huge sausage with a bit of spice to it. It was about 2 feet long! 

The atmosphere is cute and very pub like. The waiters are all dressed in German attire and they are playing German music. 

I would return again.

So this place is absolutely adorable and in the heart of old town Glendale. I wasn't as impressed with whatever I tried. But I was with a group and one of our friends picked the food so I'm not gonna base it off of that. I definitely want to go back and try it again. And this time I will pick what I want hahah. I won't make that mistake again.

LOVE IT!!!

AGH!

Their Jager Schnitzel is sooooo good.  

However, I'm allergic to nuts and they told me all of their desserts are made off premis and they all contained nuts :(
Booooo nuts.

But yeah, good stuff.

Make reservations though, becasue everytime Ive been there it was fairly crowded.

Been here twice in alittle over a month. My girl favorite cake is German Chocolate so I took her there just for that on Valentine's day after we had dinner someplace else. She loved it and said it's probably the best German Chocolate she's had. So we went back there again today and we had just the cake again. She still said its the best she's had and I have to agree its very moist and just sweet enough. And they actually give u a good slice for the price compared to other places that give u a tiny sliver. One of these days we are going to actually have to try the food there. But for now whenever we want some German Chocolate Cake. This is our spot.
Me and my fiancé just drove by and decided to try it!! It's such a cute little place. Good service. GREAT food

Hostess sat us at a table we really didn't want to sit at outside so we asked to be moved. Usually at many other restaurants staff gets annoyed when I request a seating change (I'm picky... I admit it) but they were very accommodating and friendly which was great! 
Overall, I was very happy with the staff.. it was really busy due to Glendale Glitters but our server was as attentive as he could be.
I'm only giving three stars because yes, the food was good, but my schnitzel was soggy and I spent all night sick.

My husband and I came here on a Friday night and it was a fabulous experience. Our waiter was extremely friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. He answered any questions we had. The wait time was not bad at all. Of course the best part was the food. The pretzel shnitzel is amazing! We will definitely be back.

Every trip we take we look for German restaurants. This is not what I was expecting. Should have read more of the reviews. Schnitzel wasn't pounded anywhere near enough. The wirsing was something I've never had before nor heard of and won't try it again. Bratkartoffeln were really good. Sauerbraten was VERY dry and tasteless but spaetzle was good. 

Our server was very good. The apfel strudel and sauerkraut chocolate cake were very good.

Food was delicious, I wish I could give it a higher star rating but the service was poor. We had our choice of seating: dining room, out door, bar area. We chose bar area to watch the football games. There were three of us but they seated us at a table barely large enough for 2. We tried it out and then chose to reseat ourselves to a larger table. They waiter did not complain or reprimand us so that was good. We ordered our drinks and appetizer since we knew what we wanted. We had to restate our drink order 4 times, once because they were out of the beer we requested another three times because the guy could not remember our request. How difficult is rum and coke, and two waters? We had to repeat our appetizer order twice because he 'wanted to make certain he placed the correct order.' While waiting to place our entre order, we were trying to watch the football game but 2 of the waiters were standing in front of the TV watching the game and blocking our view, we asked them twice if they could move to the left just a little bit, they never did move they just continued standing there. For entre we requested steak spatzel but they were out of steak so we finally settled on chicken spatzel. The chicken was very tender and servings were large. We had leftovers. I doubt I will go out of my way to revisit this place during my next visit.

This is probably the most old school authentic German restaurant that I have ever been to, and it is suuuuper cute, both inside and out.  It is located in downtown Glendale, and it is a great spot to stop at either before or after a Cardinals game or if you are simply on the west side of Phoenix.  The outdoor seating area is a cool spot to hang out in if the weather is nice.

All the food I have had there is absolutely delicious - I have tried several of their sausages, schnitzel, stuffed mushrooms, pork dishes, etc... and I LOVE LOVE LOVE their sauerkraut & spaetzle!!  

The service is always pretty decent, and the overall ambiance of the restaurant is great - very relaxed, chill, and usually the managers are quite attentive... they will typically personally come check on you and ask if everything is okay, and make sure you enjoyed your meal!!  :)

If you love German food ... you should definitely try this place out, because it is AWESOME & AUTHENTIC!!

Any other time, I would give Haus Murphys 5 stars. The  really let me down today. 

Really disappointed in Haus Murphys tonight. They completely dumbed down their menu for their Oktoberfest (which is grossly outside of the time line for traditional Oktoberfest anyway). 

Instead of a normally beautifully prepared jagerschnitzel with spatzle and red cabbage, I got a breaded pork loin patty with French fries.

Let me just start with "OMG that Rueben sandwich was the best I've ever had" It really was. It was so full of flavor, not like the ones I grew up on at home. Also, that Bavarian pretzel was as big as my head, which is pretty darn big, and pretty darn delicious. It only cost me $5. My boyfriend and I love the tomato soup, nothing like the canned stuff.It has some seasoning on it. The waiter was extremely kind and was happy we came by to eat there. We  have had that same waiter twice and even the other wait staff is friendly. How could someone not like this place.Now, I just need to try the schitzel clan.

Lived in Germany for 3 years! This was the best German food since we lived there. Everything we tried was excellent. Stuffed mushrooms, and bratt appetizer. Then we had beef soup. Main course We tried snitzel and topped of with sauerkraut chocolate cake. I wish we we're going to be here longer so we could go again. Definitely will return on our next trip.
I wasn't very impressed, but maybe German food isn't my thing?  Sorry I cannot provide more detail, but it was all pretty forgettable.

I was expecting a great meal and was terribly disappointed.  My meal was Weiner Schnitzel was cold and the waitress was very slow.  We believe a member of our party got food poisoning after eating the cabbage rolls.  Very disappointed.
Super delicious. Huge portions. Beers no one else has. If your looking for "authentic German" this is about as good as it gets in the American Southwest.

I like this area of Glendale. In the winter time it feels like a real city- people walking around, things to do... That's rare in Phoenix. So, the interior of this place isn't great, but the patio is nice. I have an addiction to soft pretzels and beer. Their pretzel is gigantic and delicious. I wish they had better quality pub cheese and mustard to compliment it. I'd come much more often.

The service and atmosphere here are fantastic. I asked for a warm drink and the waitress asked if I liked wine and recommended the German spiced wine. Great suggestion! It was exactly what I was looking for a red wine that was warm and spiced nicely. We all shared the pretzel. Even my husband who is not usually a pretzel fan, ate his fair share. We both ordered the sauerbraten. This is where they lost me a bit. The spätzle didn't have any flavor, we wanted to try the potato dumplings, but unfortunately those are not available on the lunch menu, I should have checked that. The red cabbage was spot on. The Sauerbraten itself was just ok. I make my own at home from a 5th generation recipe passed down from my husband's German family. Theirs tasted nothing like mine, so while it wasn't what I expected, it wasn't bad either, just very sweet, and not enough of the sour vinegar kick we are used to. On the other hand my son enjoyed it which was unexpected, since he won't eat mine. I'd come here again and try some other dishes and maybe at dinner to try the dumplings.

When I am in the mood for German food,  this is the place I come to.  In general the food is authentic.  They have entertainment, but it is hard to get a seat sometimes.  The one guy that plays the accordion is not my favorite.  I prefer to have a musician that has a personality while performing such as an occasional smile.  With that being said, beer helps.  Both inside and outside are nice for me and I will go back when I need to eat German food.

So after my first taste of German cuisine ('cause Weinerschnitzel doesn't count) I emailed my American friend living in Germany to ask if they really have any fruits and vegetables in Germany. Deep fried chicken, three types of sausage, German potato salad... Does red cabbage really count as a vegetable?  I'm not a big fan of sausage but I'm guessing the veal sausage is a little bland compared to what you might be able to find at a German Deli.  The chicken fried chicken was AMAZING and I highly recommend either that dish or the pork chop. I also thought the pretzel was worth coming back for.  I did not brave any German beer, but the house iced tea was fresh.  The wait staff was a bit overattentive, but better that than under attentive, yes? 

My American German friend was annoyed that I ate every German Food Stereotype for dinner. But since I'm not going to Germany anytime soon, I guess Haus Murphy's will do. He did confirm, however, that they DO have healthy food and fruits and vegetables there. ;)

I worked in Glendale one college summer and was in love with this restaurant. The flirty waitress with neon blue hair might have had something to do with that. I'd come here for lunch all the time and sample various German dishes I'd never heard of before, always enjoying them. It's just a cool little mom and pop German joint. Not something you see every day in Arizona.
Very great service and staff. The food is delicious and everyone was so polite. They came over to check on us and talk to our big party. Definitely recommend this place!

I really loved the homey feeling of this place. Very comfortable and extremely friendly but the food, meh.. it was hit and miss. Their brown gravy tasted like something from a grade school cafeteria which was a real let down. The potato dumpling bland and their 'giant' pretzel was smaller than the kind you get from snack bars. Also they no longer have rye bread with herb butter.. they use some bought dinner rolls, pretty lame! 

Now the good stuff.. the Bauernplatte for two was awesome! Heaping helping of sausages, kraut and friend taters.. was wonderful! The German potato salad was the best Ive had, just great!

So all the little stuff really took its toll for me on this place.. perhaps it was an off night for the kitchen? Its a pretty far drive to find out.
Shanon gave great service to our group of six.  The cabbage roll is good.  The owner is great.

Giving this restaurant a one star is pushing it a bit. 
  We had a bemusing night at this restaurant Saturday night, March 26.  We were also quite surprised at the reviews listed here.  It really doesn't sound like the restaurant that we ate at.
    We ordered the rouladen, Jaeger schnitzel, and schweizer schnitzel, our favorites from our years living in Europe.  
    The rouladen was tough and the stuffing was unusually chunky.  
    The schweizer schnitzel was deep fried to near jerky status.  Dry and tasteless.
    The jaeger schnitzel was a little better but the gravy and mushrooms didn't taste fresh reminiscent of something out of an envelope.
    There was no german salad and you were charged extra for bread.  
   Service was most amusing.  Our waiter needed a little more training.  He told us that Brotchen was German for stale bread, NOT.  We also heard him tell a neighboring table that all German wine was sweet.  
    We love German food so we try out German restaurants often in the hopes of finding one close to authentic.  Haus Murphy's is definitely not a German restaurant which could be alright if the food was edible.  Our recommendation is to avoid this restaurant.

Went here for a friend's birthday. Great place for long tables, being able to hear everyone with the option of fun live accordian music as well. Excellent beers, and yummy food. Heat lamps outdoors which was great but by the end of the night we were trying to steal them surrounding tables. Be prepared if sitting outdoors!

AUTHENTIC German cuisine in a funky, artsy area.  We really had a nice family dinner that night on our Scottsdale area vacation, and we have Guy Fieri's show to thank for the idea, and Haus Murphy's staff to thank for the experience.  My Husband lived in Germany during his time in the military, so this was a step back in time and memories of the cooking he used to enjoy from a neighbor when he lived off-base.  For our Son and I, it was just an enjoyable night out to eat at a restaurant we would not likely have known about had the place not been featured on Diner's, Drive-In's, and Dives on the Food Network.  Don't shy away from the dark beers - the staff can help you make the choices.  The ambiance is a step back in time, but in a good way.  The staff is jovial and seems genuinely pleased by people who appreciate their food.  This is a must-stop if you're in the Phoenix area.  It was an easy drive from Scottsdale, and we would go back in a heartbeat.

Outstanding German food and a great atmosphere, especially on nights when they have love polka. Love everything I've had on the menu-the eisbein is especially delicious and tender and all the sides (sauerkraut, spatzle, German potatoes). Have tried menu items like wursts and shnitzels elsewhere and none are as flavorful or well prepared. A little pricey but you definitely get your money's worth. Be prepared to wait, it's worth it!

Greeting was polite but terse; nothing friendly going on here but nothing rude, particularly. Pretzel was amazing. Chicken Schniztel was really, really bland and dry and the sauce was a little greasy. Service was adequate but didn't leave me with any warm and fuzzy feelings (and my glass was empty for a while and I was never offered a refill...that's never good.) 

The worst part, however, was that we felt we were being pressured to finish up and leave by the server. The restaurant was not that busy and this--on top of the lukewarm service to begin with--made it a "meh" and not an "a-okay". 

We might go back someday for a beer and pretzel but I doubt it.

Went here on a first date once. I'm not a huge German fanatic and don't know much about German anything but this place is an experience if you want to feel like you are actually eating dinner in a German pub. Fun live music while you eat. The beer is tasty as ever and it is definately something to try at least once! I didn't even know what shnitzel was. I'll tell you what it was....DELICIOUS!

The beer selection is great and the bartender made good suggestions. The Saurbraten iis the best I have ever had. The brats were a favorite with the kids. The staff is very friendly too. We will be back.

Do you want an escape from your typical Arizona dining experience? Do you crave an outdoor seating area were the beer flows like water and the old men dance around in traditional German clothing holding tubas? You really need to check this place out. I live about 5 minutes from here and it took me a full year and visiting relatives to finally get to downtown Glendale to check it out. 

We had a 6:30 reservation on the patio (It was a Saturday and I wanted to be safe but for 4, you could have done without the reservation). We sampled several German beers and I loved them all (wish I remembered the names). We started with the giant pretzel and sausage sampler-both were SO good I am still drooling. The Sausages were served over a bed of sauerkraut and the pretzel with spicy mustard. Everyone at the table tried something different and we all sampled everything. I loved the German potato salad served with the entrees and also the cabbage soup. 

The ambiance of this place was fantastic! The live music is from 6-8 and I really wish it went later. My boyfriend and I agree that eating there really makes you feel as though you are on vacation-far away from Arizona! I would HIGHLY recommend this place-great spot for anyone and especially out of towners looking for something unique!

Absolutely delicious! Great staff and atmosphere, a little on the pricey side, but for the food portions, quality and authenticity, totally worth it! My husband came out for an early dinner which happened to be during the Oktoberfest Happy hour, half off appetizers and certain brews. 
I ordered the Brie and hubby got a 5oz pretzel. Dinner was phenomenal! So good and too much to finish! We each had to have boxes to go, but still insisted on grabbing a couple of desserts for the road ( apple and cherry streusel) 
2 appetizers, drinks, entrées, and desserts for about $44 was pretty reasonable for this kind of place. Overall great place to eat and the staff was great and accommodating! It's a little out of the way to drive for me ( about 30 minutes from where we live) so we won't be going as often as we'd like, but I would highly recommend this place for a late lunch or dinner! 
They take cards and reservations!

First of all I found the historic part of Glendale to be attractive and fun. This restaurant is old fashion with old generation German music playing and decor that would remind you have a country restaurant in Bavaria.  I knew after one bite of the salad that I would like this restaurant.  The dressing was creamy but light in a way that only the Europeans know how to do.  I would say the same about the cream sauces on the Schnitzel.  While having the nice flavor of cream it was light.  They serve beer the way it is served in Germany--luke warm which was perfect.  The waitresses wore traditional German clothing and I enjoyed the entire experience.  I also had the cherry strudel with ice cream which was yummy and reminds of something my grandmother would make.  This restaurant is not chic or fancy but it is homey and the food is delicious German comfort food.

I've been coming here for a few years now. The service is always friendly, the food is always good, and the beer is always large :)

My brother-in-law and I like to come here and eat some good food and have a nice large cold beer. The pretzel is always crunchy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside.

I personally love the Chicken Schniztel with the Mushroom sauce. The Apple Streudel and and Bread Pudding are really amazing. The Lentil soup literally tastes like the way my grandmother used to make it (not to sound corny, but it's true). 

My favorite beer is the Franziskaner Wiessbeer which I did not see last time, but they have the "Dunkel" version of it which is good, it's just darker. I also really enjoy the Spaten Optimator.

Between the great staff, food, and beer, can't go wrong! 

p.s. make sure you wear stretchy pants, because after just the pretzel and the bit jug of beer you'll need to stretch out a bit.....

Best authentic German restaurant in Phoenix hands down! Family owned and, Rose and Chef William do a great job and make you feel right at home with not only their food but exceptional hospitality. Tonight was yet another great time at Haus Murphy's, it was packed with a big line out the door, full capacity and they killed it making sure everyone was sat and got their food and drink as fast as possible while not losing the quality in the food and atmosphere. Food was great again, as well as spirit and atmosphere! Thanks again HM!!

I would give them one star based on their food and beer but their staff is so nice. I have been here many times since I am from Glendale and my folks still live there. They love Haus Murphy's but even before I married a German I thought this place tasted bland and couldn't be authentic. After I took my husband there with the fam, he agreed the food was so far from authentic, except for the soup. The only thing I would ever order there is their soup.  Besides for The Spicery (not sure if still open) downtown Glendale's restaurants have really gone downhill. Sad.
Best German food in Phoenix. Great service, friendly staff, authentic atmosphere, and fantastic food. They make sauerkraut into ambrosia

We ordered the Anniversary Special and it was not only the most amazing tasting dish, it was only $20 for a meal for two! The Dunkle beer was one of the best I've had. Service was outstanding and I'm already looking forward to my 2nd visit!

I was walking around during the Chocolate Affair and my aunt said she saw this restaurant on tv and that it looked pretty decent. So we went and put our names on the waiting list (the wait time for the night was one and a half hours) and we continued to walk around the chocolate affair. We then returned an hour later and they were still pretty packed and we finally after two hours got into the restaurant, we knew it was a busy night so we were pretty understanding of all the chaos the servers and crew were going through and we were patient and polite to all of them. 
Our waitress was some blonde girl who wasn't returning the patient and polite manner. She was rude and condescending towards us. After about 15 min we FINALLY received the drinks we wanted (water) and our soup came out as well. My aunts friend who was joining us that evening wanted to save the soup to eat with her main course so she set it off to the side occasionally taking a few spoonfuls. The waitress clears my aunts and my soup bowl. Then she returns doesn't say a word and as my aunts friend reached for her soup the waitress snatches it, takes it away and doesn't return.
Finally after about 15-20 minutes she comes back and my aunts friend said she wasn't done with her soup. The waitress then begins to argue with her saying she needs to speak up next time. But in reality shouldn't the waitress have asked? So the waitress leaves, comes back with more soup and plops it on the table. A bit of soup fell out of the bowl as she did that. Then she doesn't say "sorry" and just goes over to her other tables.
The owner of the restaurant, a sweet woman from Germany, is doing her rounds asking how everything is. My aunt explains to her what happened and the owner even said "we usually have problems with her being rude and snippy to other employees not customers." So she ended up changing our waitress out for a nice waiter named Chris (I think). He was absolutely so much better and he was so nice. Our food came out about 45 minutes to an hour after we had originally sat, the owner explained that the kitchen was incredibly backed up and that they actually had to close the restaurant down for the rest of the night. Dinner was delicious, I had the spicy brat and the german potatoes are amazing. 
Our experience was alright, we knew it was a busy night and that our food would take awhile to be brought out. That one waitress just really needed an attitude check and understand that even though your night might be busy and a bit stressful, it's still your job to be courteous and kind to each of your customers. And we were nothing but kind and patient with her until she decided to be rude. But if you ever eat at this restaurant I recommend the spicy bratwurst and for your waiter to be Chris.

As a German, I am very picky with my German food. We went here for dinner last Saturday evening. Jack ordered the pork shank which was decent though certainly not as good as some. They were out of my first choice, Sauerbraten, so I got the Nürnberger Sausages with Sauerkraut. The sausages were a little larger than they are supposed to be. They were not grilled enough and the flavor was way to mild, diluted one could say. The Kraut was somewhere in between the more sour Frankfurt style and the sweeter Nürnberg style. Our friend had the Gulasch. It had a nice sauce but the meat was dry.

But they had good German Schnaps (we had Obstler) and Beer.

Haus Murphy's is fun place place to go for German meals and it has a lot of fans.  I found them to be a little dated with their decor and their food is usually cooked well done or over cooked.  Their service is A~OK.

Food feedback:
Apps ~ 
Sausage Sampler, Bratwurst/Krakauerwurst served over a bed of homemade Sauerkraut is tasty! 
Potato Cakes,  served with a side of Apple Sauce and sour cream was a bit overcooked very dry. 
The Giant Bavarian Pretzel Imported 10oz. salted Pretzel is highly over rated and was not cooked evenly. 

Meals ~ 
Their beef & pork sausages are all served over their homemade sauerkraut with German potato Salad or fries.
Bier Bratwurst - Beef-Pork Sausage is good.
German Bratwurst - Pork Sausage is bland.
Krakauer Wurst - Polish spicy Beef-Pork Sausage is awesome! 

Their Schnitzel's are good but again overcooked at times. I preferred their Steak Schnitzel topped with a Gorgonzola cheese and Roasted Onion Sauce.  Served with German Fried Potatoes and Bacon Roasted Green Beans. 

Beers~
Spaten Lager or Weihenstephan Hefeweizen are best, you cant go wrong here.

Went in for a cold beer on a warm afternoon. Didn't eat this trip, only quenched our thirst with a good cold liter. Enjoyed the beer garden atmosphere and friendly service. Good selection of German beer and different size options. Will definitely go back to try the food.

The schnitzel was a good portion but despite that still not worth the somewhat steep price. The paprika version of the schnitzel may be a house specialty a featured on TV (hype warnings were triggered when I learned of their TV status) but if I were to go back I'd go for something different. The appetizers which were good but not enough for us to order again.

Our server was friendly (though our hostess seemed utterly indifferent) but it took 45 minutes from the time we ordered before we received our food because "the ovens weren't on yet and filled with pots." This was after killing an hour waiting for the kitchen to open despite their website saying they were open.

Overall it was good. That's it. Glad we came. Not sure we'll be back.

This place is a must when in the area. I've been here twice and look forward to another visit soon. The German food is excellent. Everything I've had has been excellent. The staff is helpful describing the menu and offering their favorite selections. The food comes out within a reasonable time. It is reasonable priced and so good. Seriously if you have not been here you are missing out and need to try it out. The sauerkraut is amazing defiantly not from the can defiantly home made (like everything on the menu)!

What a great time and it's in an awesome location!  

This place is the go to if you're looking for authentic German food in the valley!  

We went and sat outside while we dinned.  It was a great time, felt like being in Germany for a little bit which was nice.  Everything here is as authentic as can be without leaving the state.  They even have a traditional German band that will sit outside and play while you dine to round out the experience.    

The beers are served in traditional German sizes, some bigger than your head!  As always German beer is well above average and you won't be disappointed with whatever one you get.

The food again is very traditional.  Try the pretzels that they have imported, it's bliss in a twisted, salted package.  We had the Guinness brats and the jäger schnitzel.  The jäger sauce was very good and they defiantly seem to know what they are doing here.

Quantity over quality.  Split a combo for 2 with the wife - was a HUGE heaping plate of meat and we walked out with plenty of leftovers.  Good but not great - schnitzel was soggy and sausages came out lukewarm like they're just sitting in a giant, greasy tub in the kitchen to be tonged out en masse.  I liked their mustards - just the right amount of flavor and not over powering, helped make up for the flat taste of the sausages.  Overall, the place has a nice atmosphere with an old town bar feel, though it does have a weird stale smell when you first walk in.  Band on Friday a nice touch, but a bit repetitive.  Table next to the us got a giant pretzel that looked pretty awesome - I'd come back for that and a German beer.  I'd rate this place 4 stars as a bar, but only 3 as a restaurant.
Good, solid, stick-to-your-ribs German food here. Can be a bit pricey, but worth a visit. Check out the nice little bier garden on a spring day.

Made the 30 minute drive from north Phoenix & glad we did. Bar tender was great to talk to while waiting for our table. Great German (&Austrian) beer selection. Bloody Mary hade A1 steak sauce in it (really good)
Food was very authentic . ( we go to Germany every year on business) We will go back soon.
If you like schnitzel.. this is the place for you. Authentic German food and beers. Reasonably priced too. We do not usually get dessert but the cherry strudel was the perfect size and delicious.

I ventured out to Haus Murphy's since it's not far from my office and I was looking for a good Reuben and a Yelp'er had noted they had a good Reuben. 
The atmosphere at Haus Murphy's is very nice out on the patio (i didn't make it inside) and down town Glendale adds to it's ambiance. 
So let's get to the Reuben. Average, and over priced at $9.95. It came with German potato salad that i like but for the price and service I don't think I will be back for lunch. When you consider that wholesale corn beef cost $3.49 / pound and they put less than a 1/4 pound on the sandwich it was very disappointing. And the German potato salad was good but come on potatoes are cheep. Is it just because Glendale is a high rent district? Well the Haus of Murphy may have a lot going for it but it's not going to win over the casual lunch crowed that's for sure.

What a neat place in downtown Glendale.  It really doesn't get any more authentic.  And if it does, let me know!  From our server, to our food, to our drinks, everything was great.  

Don't go here, and expect to not get real German and then complain that it didn't taste the way you would have wished..  I read a few reviews of this place, and I think it's funny that people complain about the food.. What do you expect?  It's not going to be your traditional American fare..  That's my rant.  I'll stop now..

I had the gulash and it was yummi.  i also tried the chicken schnitzel and some sausage and it was all really good.  The paprika soup was great, and the bread basket was also delicious.  I ordered a potato dumpling, and I didn't like it at all!   My only complaint.

There were some guys playing an accordian and a tuba outside, and all the wait staff dresses in German attire.

Fun fun night!

Yummy! Yummy! First time at a German restaurant and it was delicious! Don't pass up the sauerkraut chocolate cake - best chocolate cake you'll ever have! Plus, the staff was friendly and efficient. The only reason I didn't give a 5 star is because their menu is way too big and the servers have to dress in poorly fitted costumes. Overall, our new favorite place!

Have had this place bookmarked in my yelp for over a year and finally stopped in tonight
The food was solid.  I haven't had jaeger schnitzel since being in Munich two years ago and I was not disappointed in Haus Murphy's!
The pretzel and giant radler was a great way to start the meal and the cherry strudel was an awesome finish
If this place is on your list, check it out sooner rather than later.  It's delicious!

3.5 stars 

Went with a large group for a birthday party. We had two of the long tables in the back. Street parking only. Good luck finding a spot on a busy Friday or Saturday night. 

The decor: everything German. You feel like you are at grandma's with the mix matching plates and wooden chairs. Lots of cheesy German posters on the wall. 

The staff: very friendly. They close at 9 and we left close to 10. They were very nice about it and didn't kick us out. The server was willing to multiple checks for the couples in the goup. The service was a bit slow but it might have been because we were a big group. Our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu which was helpful. 

 food: everyone on Yelp raved about the big pretzel ($5) so we had to do it. Don't get me wrong, it was good, but I think I had it  hyped up in my head that it did not meet the expectation. Others loved it. Also tried the stuffed mushrooms. Only 4 come in a an order for $10. That was disappointing but they were good. We got the veal sausage ($11) and the filet medallions ($16). My fiance loved his veal sausage and I only kind of liked my dinner. The brown sauce was pretty heavy and medallions were not med. rare as promised - more like medium. Every meal also comes with a soup. It was not so good but I like the concept. Maybe just not my taste. My meal also came with mashed potatoes (yum) and red cabbage (super yum). 

drink: the steins of beer were 1 liter. Translation - an S ton of beer for $8!
Funny thing is, we took our forgeign exchange "son" here for some  comfort food.

Looking to surprise spouse while in Phoenix with good German. Of course, the Rouladen was not as good as her Mom's, but then again, I am sure there never will be one that competes with "Mom's."

Other than competing with Mom's, the food and service were excellent.  The Rouladen, though not Mom's, was thoroughly enjoyed, the Brats, German potatoes, sauerbraten and spatzel were delicious. Desserts, wow!!  Got to try the sauerkraut cake - it's a chocolate lover's delight.

I was reading the reviews about haus murphy after my dad had made the reservations for the night.  Good reviews so I was looking forward to having dinner there

Started off with a brown lager beer which was very good.  My sister got the unfiltered wheat beer. Very good choices to unwind and relax after walking around the town square seeing the Christmas lights  

For appetizers we did the stuffed mushrooms and the soft Bavarian pretzel  with the spicy mustard.  Wow.  The mushrooms were perfect and very tasty.  The pretzel is huge and the mustard was a good addition to the pretzel.  Make sure you order both when you go there.   

Next thing that came was the chefs soup which comes with the main course.  Cream of mushroom soup.   It was OK.   

All of us decided to have the meatloaf with sautéed green beans and German potato salad.   I know we should have tried something different to get a good selection but the meatloaf sounded great.  I tell you what.   It did not disappoint anyone at the table.  Very good.     

Only thing I wish I would have tried is some of the desserts but after the mushrooms, pretzel and the meatloaf, all of us were stuffed.  

I think it would be a good idea to just go there for desserts.  

Good choice for dinner.

I've been to Haus Murphy's at least once every couple of years since I moved to Glendale when I was a wee lass over 20 years ago. My dad was always obsessed with this place due to his love of German food and the movie Murphy's Romance. 

The menu has changed little over the years. When I was a kid I really liked the schnitzel they served that had ham and cheese on top, almost like a schnitzel cordon bleu. Now I enjoy the Jagerschnitzel whenever we go. The food is always just ok. Never mind blowing. Never terrible. 

Now that I'm a grown-up, I feel like I should really come here more often to enjoy the beer garden and have some brews, but it's usually still a family affair, and there are fun places to drink closer to where I live. I like the eclectic decor and vibe, but rarely find myself drawn here.
Great place, food was delicious. They had the typical German beers on tap. I had the Saurbrauten and the apel strudel, I highly recommend both. The staff was friendly and the environment was fun.

The hubby had his heart set on taking me here, but I was a little worried because of the negative reviews, I really don't like bland food.  Well, we did not have that! The food was full of flavor, well seasoned, big servings, prepared well.  The beer was GREAT, I am sorry I can't remember the name of the one we had... It was the dark one, that was light but tasted like a dark :) haha! Hope that helps! I had the schnitzel, a pork one with Swiss and ham... I would not order it again, but not because there was something wrong with it, it just wasn't my thing, I went on the recommendation of the waitress, but I have different taste... The hubby had a sausage, same story as the schnitzel, except he liked it and would order it again.  The pretzel was very good!! The soup was good.  I LOVED the spatzel (noodles).  I stirred in butter and salt and pepper... YUM, I could make a meal out of that and the German potato salad!! and beer and pretzels!!
Love their Weiner schnitzel ala Holstein! Best ever. You have to request it in advance as they don't have it all the time.

Last Thursday I had the pleasure of joining a bunch of Yelpers at a UYE here.  I had not been here in over 10 years and they have move East on Glendale a bit since then.  At that time they were out of sauerbraten so they served us a stew of sorts that wasn't on the menu and I remember it being quite good and large plates of food.

I still desired to try their sauerbraten so that is what I ordered.  It comes with a potato dumpling, gravy, and red cabbage.  I expect a piece of beef marinated for three days to not require a knife to cut and to have some flavor of it's own before dowsing it in gravy, and sauerbraten I have had before met this.  This one to me was quite chewy and the gravy too sweet.  Gravy is one of those things that just because I think it is too sweet doesn't make it bad or improperly made, it just didn't suit my taste.  If I had liked the gravy better it would have improved my image of the dumpling which, without gravy, was sort of tasteless.  The red cabbage was just as I expected and have had before.

Now that I have grumbled about my meal.  I got a bite of a big pretzel two of which the restaurant comped us.  I thought it was a bit salty but overall a very pleasant surprise.  I chose to try mine with butter.  The bread pudding was delicious, I chose the small size and it was easily enough for two to share, but I ate it all anyway. :-)  All of this food was washed down with a good tasting Spaten lager.  The service was pretty good, especially for our large group.  And they were willing to split the checks, which even with a party of about 18 did not have the mandatory added gratuity, although I doubt if anybody in our party tipped less than 18% because they was nothing wrong with the service to warrant a poor tip.  The owner didn't introduce himself but he did make a couple of appearances on the patio to see how things were going.

I could easily be enticed to come back to the patio and enjoy a beer.  I think I would opt for one of the appetizers like a pretzel or the potato pancakes to soak the beer up with.

My fiance and I went here a few weeks ago.  I had raved and raved about this place to her because every single time I had been there before, it was one of the best meals I have had in Glendale.  But boy, was this last go around a real kick to the groin.

Meal:  I had the pork schnitzel and the potato pancakes.  My fiance, who is a vegetarian, couldn't get anything except for the potato pancakes because they had a scaled down menu during the holiday season. Seriously?  After I called to get reservations and check the websites, you would have figured that they would have mentioned something about a smaller menu than what is typical.

Taste:  Out of all my meals at Haus Murphy's, this was by far the worse.  My food was cold, bland, and they didn't have my favorite beer on tap like they typically do.  Again- scaled down menu.  I got the impression that at least during the holiday season they just pre-cook everything well in advance and just microwave it when ordered.  4 out of 10.

Value:  When I used to go to Haus Murphy, I never got really worked up about value because the good was always good and it was so different compared to most places in Phoenix.  But this time around, given that the menu was compacted and the food wasn't very good, I would the the overall value of my last experience was pretty poor.  2 out of 5.

Service/Cleanliness:  Beyond the menu issue, our serve was pretty decent.  She was polite and friendly.  She didn't go above and beyond but at least she wasn't ruin.  But again . . . the shorten menu . . . that's what really hurts the score this time.  4 out of 10.

Atmosphere:  The atmosphere is always fun here.  The big steins.  The music.  Everyone is dressed up.  4 out of 5.

Overall:  I will give Haus Murhpy's one more try and hopefully they will earn back their typical 5 start performance.  14 out of 30 points, 1 out of 5 stars.

I am broken hearted!  I adore German food I've eaten it all over the country and prepared it dozens of times. The spätzle they served me was more like bad spaghetti. I almost cried. The red cabbage must have been prepared 3-4 days ago as it was mushy and almost inedible. I'm pretty sure at that point my eyes welled up. But what brought the tear down my cheek was the jaeger schnitzel.  The center was barely done and the edges were like shoe leather!  They didn't pound it properly and poof they made me cry. But I'm a sucker for bread pudding and I thought maybe their forte is dessert, it is NOT it was dense and almost tasteless. Sad. Very sad.
 If Guy Fieri had this food and was ok with it. They need to give me his job! If not he should stop lying to us!  Please comment and follow me for more reviews! I would love to have you!

Angela was our waitrss, very personable and helpful explaining the menu options as well as the beer selection.
We tried the pretzel and was shared with 4 adults, we also added the cheese sauce which I would pass on next time, they charged $2.50 just for that item. The two mustards were great, house spicy and sweet mustard. BTW the pretzel was out of this world.
I tried the Haxe and the wife ordered the Cabbage Roll. Both items were good, not fantastic.
Four of us shared the Kraut Chocolate Cake, OMG it was marvelous. So the whole night started out great with the Pretzel and ended super with the Kraut Cake.
Don't miss the entertainment in the bar two musicians playing polka music, it was fantastic.
Will definitely return and next time I will dance a few polka's.

2nd meet up for the International Supper Club UYE (#ISCUYE) for 2014 and Haus Murphy was the place picked to try! 

It was a big group this time; we took 2 tables, holy cow!! Our server was a little frazzled about having to deal with this. We were pretty darn close to the bar and our server told me that he was not taking any drink orders until everyone had arrived and I had already known some were 10 to 15 mins out, so off to the bar I went!  

I'm still fairly new to the whole ordering beer, so when I walked up to the bar the bar tender asked what do I like, and I told him I'm still unsure, since I'm new to drinking beer, he said oh you must be 21 haha Love him!! He offered me samples of all the beers they have on tap, which I thought I was pretty sweet and I went with a nice glass of Warsteiner Dunkel, it went perfectly well with everything! Kudos to the bar tender!   When I had already ordered my drink my server came to me and told me well I'm taking drink orders now, and I told him you told me to go to the bar and get my own drink so I did and I have.  

Everyone placed their order, even folks who arrived 20 mins late got their order in, everyone except me got their food, even my daughter who was on the same check as me, ten minutes go by and the server noticed I didn't have my meal, oh it must have been forgotten. UGH!!!! I was upset!! But within minutes my food appeared and I took a bite and OMG ITS DELISH!!! and being upset slowly faded away, one could say I ate my feelings LOL (not really)   I ordered the Huhner (Chicken) Schnitzel with German fried potatoes and Wirsing, it did also come with a bowl of split pea soup, which was amazing, reminded me of the times I went to Pea Soup Andersen's in California, so good! The schnitzel with mushroom gravy was soo yummy!! Couldn't believe I ate it all!! It also came with fried taters and this Irish girl luvs them taters & wirsing, it was my 1st experience with that, didn't even know what I was eating when I started, it was creamy melty goodness, learned it was cream cabbage, omg really? That was dang good!

But what I came for was the Sauerkraut Cake, yea that's right, sauerkraut cake!!! I have heard nothing but praise for this cake, they said its better than a death by chocolate cake!! I had to find out for myself!! OOOOMMMMYYYYYGGGAAAWWWDDD!!!! It's amazing!!  

Sometimes the company makes the evening more pleasurable then the overall experience & the food was simply delicious , service well that could have been better.  I'm already craving some more schnitzel so I see myself coming back soon.
Enjoyed a pretzel, bratwurst and chocolate sauerkraut cake. Carlene was super accomplishment and her recommendations were spot on!

Ugh, I would really like to like this place. 

Getting to the location is awful, traffic is painfully slow since there are no left turn signals on the main street. Parking was okay since it was Saturday afternoon, but having to re-park every two hours kinda sucked and the food was bland!! I have been to Germany, and all the dishes I had there were flavorful, and yummy...but this place? bland and embarrassing. 

I met a group there to play board games and the staff was so nice and great! But the turkey sandwich with horseradish mayo was dry and gross. I ordered it thinking the mayo would throw me off but "hey, it's a German restaurant, let's give it a whirl" I couldn't even taste the special mayo! My homemade sandwiches have more flavor than this one. 

I ordered the apple strudel hopeful for some redeeming quality to compliment the great service...0-2, again like the Compass Restaurant, the best thing about the dessert was the sliver dollar shot of whip cream. 

This place was so accommodating and fun to hang out at, with really nice service...but I wish I could have something nice to say about the food.

Definitely one of my favorite restaurants, The Staff although a bit eccentric fits the place to a T.  A wide selection of German Beer's including Spaten, and Warsteiner, I personally prefer the Spaten Oktoberfest, 

They don't know how to make bad soup, I just wish they gave you more, every time we've been here they've always had simple but awesome soup.

And of Course "Schnitzel" or as they call it on the menu

"The Art of Schnitzel" if pounding pork thin breading it then covering it with sauces, other meats, cheeses etc, is an art form, then consider me a discerning critic.  Though I must admit I tend to order the Schweizer Schnitzel, which has Ham and Emmanthaler cheese under the breading.

We've had the desserts in the past and the Strudel is very memorable, as well as the german chocolate cake.

Maybe this year we'll make it out for their actual Oktoberfest celebration, we've been meaning to go for years.

When I think of glendale I don't think of Germans, but this place makes me more and more want to take a vacation to Germany.

I have eaten here several times now.  My father is from Germany and we took him here as a treat, he really liked it and the food was "authentic mostly".  I also went with my son and husband for Oktoberfest celebration with my German Club and the food was remarkable that night.  I enjoy eating here but I will say the down side for me, simply, not enough beer choices.  I am a stout and ale kind of girl and they only had one and it was not great.  My son loved the food and often asks when we will be going back.  I highly recommend this place but be sure of one thing, it fills up fast and the seating is a little tight (meaning they don't have a lot of space) and unless the patio is open you may have a wait time!

Haus Murphy, what happened?!  Our family has eaten at Haus Murphy many times in the past with great results, but our recent visit there was a disaster.

First, what went right:  our party of 7 was seated on time at 7p.  Drink orders were taken by our friendly waitress, although the restaurant was out of Optimator, the favorite beer of one of our party. Our food order was taken promptly after that and soup appeared a few minutes later, as expected.  The oompah band was fun, as usual!

What didn't work:  Our entrees were delivered at 8:30p, a full hour after the soup and 1.25 hours after our initial order!  When we commented/questioned the long wait, we received no apology from the waitress, but were told they were busy.  This long-standing Glendale restaurant is always busy so that reason seemed pretty lame.  Six of our dinners were then served.. The dinner ordered "without bacon" was served 15 minutes later, when everyone else was at least half done eating.  One of the dinners served came out with a kitchen substitution as they had run out of spaetzle.  Isn't that like a Chinese kitchen running out of rice?!  Ironic that according to the menu, substitutions are not allowed by the customer at Haus Murphy so you'd think they wouldn't automatically substitute either, but instead inform the customer when they are out of an item and let them choose what to do. The person ordering the dinner did so because spatzle is his favorite and therefore accepted goulache to get the spaetzle.  His preference is smoked pork chop - no spaetzle allowed for that entrée however.

To be fair, two of our party really enjoyed their dinners (schnitzel and spicy brats), but the other four did not.  The waitress said she would ask the manager to stop by our table.  He did not so she asked him a second time.

The manager did apologize for the evening, the beer and food they were out of, the bad timing on service, and the unevenness of the food temps, but did not seem interested in hearing our concerns.  He was dismissive to us, but did remove the cost of one of the dinners in response.  

We're left wondering how this could have been such a good restaurant, a favorite for years, that had so many problems.

I've never eaten at the Haus, but I'm pretty up front as to not being a food reviewer and more of a booze reviewer, thus I feel completely confident that I can say Haus Murphy's is likely one of the great places in the PHX area to refresh yourself with a disgustingly large beverage.

When I was visiting the Glendale area we decided to eschew the corporate Westgate area for Downtown and a better decision has never been made. The Haus served us giant German beers outside.  They were large enough for us to take pictures of ourselves hiding behind them! What more do you want out of life?

Having grown up in the german-centric area of northwest Ohio, I have some sense of authentic German establishments, and this place has it in spades. Again, I'll leave the assessment of their food up to you, but if you're downtown and want to wet your palette with a giant fine German lager, you can't do better than Haus Murphy's. When I'm there, Ich bin ein Berliner.

Haus Murphy is getting 4 BIG stars! Why not 5 you ask? Only because they are in Glendale and it takes an ungodly amount of time to trek out there. With that being said... 

I have been to Murphy's 3 times and have enjoyed it immensely each time. I have never been to Germany or another really authentic German restaurant, save the German buffet at Epcot Center, so I don't think that really counts. The restaurant is on the smaller side and it can be very busy on the weekends, so make a reservation. They do have a nice beer garden outside where you can eat as well, weather permitting. They have a few larger booths in the front room, but have a large open area with tables and some community type tables in the bar area. I believe they have a polka band there on the weekends also. So if polka music is your bag you should check it out. 

On to the important stuff. Food and beer! Again, their food has been consistent all 3 visits. They have a simple salad that comes with most entrees, but the dressing is awesome! The mushroom soup is great too! They also bring out warm, fresh pumpernickel and sourdough I believe. I have tried the chicken with mushrooms and cream sauce, the rouladen, and the meatloaf. I can't remember the name for the meatloaf, but that is essentially what it is. It comes with mashed potatoes and cabbage. It is fantastic! I believe it was served with a brown sauce/gravy. The offer a very large selection of beers. I have had the Spaten Lager and the Spaten Oktoberfest. Both quality. You have to get them in the large glass steins they offer. Lets keep it authentic folks. 

The desserts are pretty good too. The Apple Strudel was very good, but does have nuts. If you can pick around them I would suggest it. The Black Forest cake was a little dry, but good. 

If you live nearby or don't mind driving go and give Haus Murphy's a try.

A Friday afternoon of lounging in the beer garden at Haus Murphy's definitely tops my list of favorite things to do. Start with a glass of Weizen, a tall one, then cruise through their extensive menu of Bavarian specialties. 

Schnitzel or brats with a side of kraut , black forest ham sandwich, oriental chicken salad(?!), perhaps a strudel for dessert. I opted for the Reuben sandwich on my last visit. Though quite tasty, the corned beef was sliced a bit too thick for my taste- the deli down the street has them beat hands down. Stick with the sausage.

Whether I stop in here for a beer and giant pretzel with cheese for a snack while shopping in Glendale, or going to dinner for their Wiener schnitzel or old tyme brat. I love this place every time, I've been coming here with my family for years and we love it every single time. Reminds me of the little German town back home in Texas, Fredericksburg. If you're ever close by even if you just stop by for a beer and pretzel, the environment is amazing here. Inside the restaurant or out on the patio, especially now during the holiday seasons. It's a must if you're ever in Glendale !

If you're looking for German food, this is where you want to be.  I think German food is a little boring, but every now and then a schnitzel sounds good. We tried most of the appetizer menu. They were good but not extraordinary. I would definitely get a schnitzel that sounds good to you though! We tried two and they were both perfect!

Went on my birthday, service was great, food not so good. Have eaten there many times in the past and food was 5stars all the way. I had the Yeager Schnitzel gravy too thick and cold. Times must be tough as if you want rolls,it will cost you an additional 2.50 I'm wondering if the restaurant has changed ownership.

My girlfriend and I have been to Murphy's probably 4 times; each time we try something different, and each time we love what we get.

The atmosphere is great on Friday/Saturday nights, and on certain nights they have a band play German polka music, which adds to the experience.

The food, although relatively expensive, is priced well considering how much you get and how good it tastes.  The beer is quite expensive, but you can try some pretty unique German beers, so for some it may be worth it.

The schnitzel (any meat), potato pancakes and Black Forest cake are a personal favorite.

I always recommend Haus Murphy's to people looking for good food, and especially for those looking to try something a little different.

What an great place!

Great german food is very hard to find these days.  
Haus Murphys is a reminder of fantastic food gone bye. The paprika schnitzel is incredible, and the old standbys like sauerkraut and German potato salad and the red cabbage are all fantastic. Old style beer garden and wonderful beers from Germany are also available. 

This place has great food, lots of fun, and I love the music too. 

Oh, the sauerkraut chocolate cake is phenomenal, yes it sounds gross but it's not

I'm a big fan of Haus Murphys and you're in the area and want an authentic German meal, you won't be disappointed.
Really enjoy this place. Food is incredible and the German beer selection is terrific.
Amazing food.  It actually exceeded our expectations.  Each dish was full of unique flavors, everybody was very satisfied!  Prices were higher than I expected but the food was worth it.

Really fun atmosphere - live polka music made me smile!!! The food was great. The chicken schnitzel with the white wine sauce was AMAZING. And the pretzel appetizer was delicious. This is definitely a great place to go to experience something unique and fun.

Just gotta say... OMG AMAZING... Ive never been disappointed eating here but tonight Jimmy and Justin went above and beyond typical servers. They made our experience at Haus Murphy so wonderful. Yall would have gotten 5 stars but your buser took my bfs daughters plate before she was done eating and tried taking his. Busers should NOT come to your table unless forks are down and the check is on the table. When i spoke to the manager Jersey about this she was dumbfounded. Apologized so many times for this poor service. Its ok... Between the food and Jersey, Jimmy, and Justin we will be back for sure...
Wow holy food Batman.  We are here for Octoberfest ! $10 cover but worth it.   The pretzel is off the hook !

Great food, great service, great space!!! LOVE THIS PLACE. Have been here for their October fests over the years (yes a must try!) and came here today to take my Dad and Uncle to lunch for Veterans Day. 1st off the service was great. Jimmie greeted us and got us a table outside. He promptly asked what we wanted for drinks- me and my Aunt decided to try the Ayinger Celebrator (bock beer) which yes if you like a dark beer it is a full bodied yummy beer. Next to order. Three orders of Original German Brat an order of Huhner (chicken) Schnitzel  and a side of the potato pancakes with apple sauce. The food came quickly and was piping hot and everyone raved about their meals! The portions are big enough that we all got to go boxes to bring home!  

I recommend Haus Murphy to anyone that enjoys good food and atmosphere. Side note. Year round they do 10% off the bill for veterans. On Veterans day they give a nice 15% off as thanks!

By far some of the best German food I have ever had here in the States! All of the dishes were good and the deserts were great! 

Will be a future stop for us!

We had a great time sitting on the patio enjoying appetizers and beverages (great beer selection). The ambiance brought my husband and I back to a beer garden in Germany. The band playing was festive and entertaining. Even my 3 year old had fun dancing and swaying with the crowd.

We will definitely be going back! BTW... if you order the pretzel be prepared to share. It's huge!
I absolutely love this place. Great German food. Anytime I'm in AZ we make a trip there. Guy Fieri thinks so too.

WoW...we'd never been to Haus Murphy's and boy did we have a blast!  We met our dining partners there, neither of which had even heard of the place.  Both being AZ natives and all...?  But at any rate the service was A+ the food was A++ and the Entertainment sublime.  Just what you would want from a German Restaurant.  Reminded us of the places we'd eat at in Chicago...!  
We had the appetizer 'Fladenbrot Pizza' what a great combination of flavors!  Then on the 'Brie en Croute'...another triumph! followed by their signature 'Giant Pretzel' and GIANT it was.
A couple of the diners had the "Best" seller, Jäger Schnitzel, one had the Steak Schnitzel, and I had the Nürnberger/Kassler (combo for one).  The consensus of the table was mine was THE BEST...although they all would have ordered their entree again for sure.!  The pork chop on my plate was perfection!  The bratwurst...well...just like I used to get in Wisconsin...oh the memories of Wisconsin.  Sorry to digress...!  
The meal, the service, the entertainment...well worth the drive from North Scottsdale.  I can't wait to do it again!

Haus Murphy's is a cool little spot in downtown Glendale.  I enjoy the little patio beer garden and the eclectic wait staff.  They have great brews on draft- and teamed with the outdoor seating option is pretty close to perfection in my mind.  

That being said, I have never ate any food item that someone deemed German that I actually loved.  I also do not eat anything made out of pig (so, your everyday sausage doesn't do it for me).  So, Haus Murphy's is cool and I'd go there if someone suggested it, but I personally haven't found a meal that works for me there.  I have tried the chicken with mushroom sauce and wasn't in love- just eh.  

I will, of course, give it several more tries because of proximity and the presence of a beer garden in hopes that I find a food item that does it for me.

Brie Appetizer was awesome, Pretzel was good, great stone ground mustard. Rouladens were a little dry, but fork tender. The red cabbage was too sweet for my taste, i like a little more vinegar bite, spatzel was ok. DDD hyped it up alot. Ive had better, but thats back in chicago.
Authentic German food for being in Arizona, great service had an enjoyable experience, will come again.

We were passing through town and checked Yelp and found this wonderful German restaurant. In addition to the delicious food, they have outstanding service. All the people we interacted with were genuinely interested in their jobs and had the owner mentality. We had the soup which was authentic and not laden with filler like flour or cornstarch. We had a variety of sausages with kraut and German potatoes. We also enjoyed a pre dinner salad which was exceptional. One really nice thing was that they waited for us to finish our salad before bringing the soup, then waited for us to finish the soup before bringing the main entre'. We will stop here again next time!
Back again and still had great service great food and a good time salad was fresh soup with bountiful and meal was great

I've been wanting to try this place since seeing it featured on Diners Drive-ins and Dives. I was anticipating a ton of flavors, and I had high hopes for this place because of all the great reviews. The Paprika Schnitzel was bland and a huge let down. The Potato rolls were bland too and tasted like mash potatoes that needed salt.
