The only thing that was good was the potatoes and the cabbage that came with the dish. They were my favorite part of the food. Overall, the food was not very impressive.

I really enjoy this restaurant! The atmosphere is great, the food is super delicious. However, I'm giving a 3 star rating due to a recent experience. 

I wanted the Beef Roulade, and I was asked if I wanted 1 or 2. I said 1, and went about eating my delicious pretzel. Then our (very nice) server came back and informed me that I cannot order 1, due to the way they are prepped and portioned, if I still want the Beef Roulade I must order 2 and pay the extra $4.95 for the second one. 

Of course I did because I really wanted it, however this is a horrible practice to enforce bad prep practices on customers. If you can't honestly offer them in singles, take it off the menu and sell them in pairs only. 

Also you put your server in an awkward situation which is really super uncool.
Great comfort food, from the Bavarian pretzel, bratwurst, schnitzel, pastas.  It's all made to order and delicious!!!!
Awesome food, just awesome! Top notch beer selection.  Great staff. Beer garden is great setting.

Heard so much about this place and was looking for an authentic German restaurant for my mom who's from Germany. I stopped by on 7/6/16 to get something to go. She wanted Weiner schnitzel so I ordered that with sauerkraut instead of the German potatoes. 
When we opened the container at home, the sauerkraut had a very strong smell. The Weiner Schnitzel was a piece of veal breaded and fried- no flavor- none. Both the breading or the meat itself. The sauerkraut was very strong smelling and had a strong sour taste. The other side dish was a warm cabbage & cream dish. It Was passable. It also came with a soup, not sure what the name was, but it was a brown thickened beef flavor with a bit of onion. Kind if sweet & sour?? It was okay. I didn't care for the meal and my mom said she didn't either. She said the sauerkraut shouldn't be strong smelling or so sour tasting. 
As for the restaurant, it was empty, no patrons, but it was clean. I was greeted warmly as I walked in, but nothing after that. 
I will not return and maybe others love the food, but as you can see from my picture, it didn't even look appealing!

I wish I could give separate stars for food and service. This place was very busy when we walked in, as it was Glendale Glitters. We expected to wait for a table, but were pleased when we were seated immediately. We ordered the sampler for 2 and drinks. I also wanted a salad, and the sever told me it was $2, which seemed reasonable. Our drinks arrived, and we settled in to our outdoor seat. The German band was a nice touch, and the heaters kept us toasty. Our food arrived soon after we finished hubby's soup and my salad. As the food runner approached, time slowed down to slow motion. He almost slid the entire plate on my lap but, instead, he reached to balance the plate and knocked over my full soda. On my lap. On the cold patio. I was not angry about the spilled soda--I was a server forever, and these things happen. I could tell this kids was freaked out, and we felt bad for him. He grabbed some napkins, apologized profusely, and then almost took off when I asked him for a refill on soda. He brought me a refill, but left our table a complete mess. We cleaned up as much as we could, and covered the ice left on our table with a bunch of napkins. I was soaked and our table was trashed. Our server came over and brought more napkins, but did not clean up our table until prompted. Pretty strange. Also, we ordered a sampler type meal, and no one really told us what was what on the plate, so we didn't know what we were eating. The food was quite good. I can't really tell you what exactly it was, but it was a huge portion for us. 
  Our server also apologized but nothing else happened. If this would have happened when I was a server, I would have asked the manager to stop by the table and offer to at least buy dessert, if not the entire check. I was soaked; this wasn't a couple of drops. If you read my other reviews, I am not one to expect free food, but if there ever was a time, this was it. But, nothing was com'd. In fact, the side salad I ordered was $4 instead of $2.

This restaurant is fantastic!  In historic Glendale, it truly stands out (in a good way).  They have amazing food, fun music, and a good selection of beer.  Remember though- a Liter of beer is definitely bigger than a Pint.  If you do forget, there's a park caty-corner for naps!
Only place in the valley to go for German fare. I recommend the Jagerschnitzle.

First time here, this restaurant is comparable to some of the best German comfort food found at various places that I have been stationed in Germany. The potato pancakes served as an appetizer were correct, and some of the lightest that I have ever had. the mushroom soup was perfect, and the service was excellent and attentive.  This place is definitely worth a return

Third visit on busy Thursday in March during spring training and NASCAR weekend. Five hungry guys who soon had liters of beer in their fists, including real German October fest brews. Stuffed asigo topped mushrooms are special. Snitzels and ramadle German quality. Very satisfying night with good friendly quick service. 

1/19/18 update: menu and beer selection have been reduced. Still a couple schnitzel choices but not house made, likely outsourced.

Okay food.  Wiener schnitzel lacked flavor, waiter  as  as he thought he was.  Portions are reasonable sized and prices are decent.   Lousy neighborhood with homeless in front of restaurant.   If you must have German food, this place will suffice.

What a fascinating place! I was here from out of town and was excited to have something I have never had before. None of the authentic menu items were things I had experienced. 

I had the Jager Schnitzel, which was delicious. We were there around 7:45 and they were out of chicken schnitzel and beef roulade. Arrive early to get the popular stuff!
After seeing this place on diners drive-ins and dives had to try it the paprika schnitzel was wonderful as was the stuffed mushrooms and potato pancakes four stars for that the beer gave you five

I ordered the combo for one that consisted of a brined pan seared pork chop and 2 veal suasages. The food was good but slightly under seasoned for my taste. The pork was cooked perfectly, while the sausages were on the dry side and the German fried potatoes were a little under done. The potato salad however, was fantastic as was the sauerkraut!!!
The atmosphere is really warm and inviting with German decor all around and especially nice when added to the Christmas season. 
Staff was very friendly and the service was quick.
If given the opportunity I would gladly dine there again on my next visit, but would probably sample some of the other options on the menu...from what I heard from the other diners around me the Sauer Sauerbraten is to die for.

The service was great and the stuffed mushrooms were delicious. We both had the Paprika Schnitzel with German fried potatoes and Wirsing (cabbage with cream sauce). The fried potatoes were great, everything else was ok. The meal was almost $50 without drinks, so it was a little pricey.

Great place for a brew in the outdoor biergarten. 

Food is pretty average. I did enjoy the sausage appetizer.

My husband and I discovered this place when it was much smaller and located down the road.  The old location was a bit cozier however the restaurant still feels like an authentic German restaurant and the food is amazing.  This is one of my favorite places to take friends and family.

This place always amazes us.....always fabulous food, always friends attentive service and well worth the drive from Mesa.  There are 2 German restaurants in Mesa but neither are worthy of 2nd visits so we just make the drive and always are glad we did to get the best of the best at Haus Murphy.  Just love the outside area.

So simple... so authentic... just the type of place to make you feel like you're back in Germany --- that is, if you've ever been to Germany.  If you haven't, check this place out and you can pretty much save a trip over there.

It's hard to go wrong here.  The food is classic German --- sausages, kraut, schnitzels, etc.  Oh, and don't forget about the tall glasses of beer that you can drink in the beer garden!

This place is great! The food is amazing and the staff is very friendly and helpful. If it wasn't a Sunday night I probably would have drank like 5 DAS BOOTs, just kidding they don't have those, but I would have had at least 2 or 3 MASS of beers. One thing everyone talks about in regards to this place is their GIANT pretzel which is very good. I am a big fan of the variety of food they have and the imported beers you really can't find anywhere else in the area. If you ever feel adventurous and a person that likes to try new things, I would highly recommend this place. I don't live in the area but if I did I would probably be here at least 2 or 3 times a week, the pretzel and Uber would be my best friends.

Really fun to get out of the boring norm in Peoria!  Not a chain and we liked it. The food was good, the atmosphere was entertaining and enjoyable. Not a fan of the German get-ups the girls were wearing (a little too literal and cheesy).  The restaurant could stand a little refreshing--but over all definitely worth it and we will go back.  Get ready for some meat and potatoes.
HUGE FOOD PORTIONS!!! Lots of different beer's on tap! Great cocktails! Love the atmosphere and the service is always great! You gotta try it!

Never been here before but seen lots of times while driving to my favorite comic book store, Drawn To Comics. I had the Sausage Sampler appetizer (2 brats with sauerkraut and sauces) for lunch, which was very tasty and filling.  Paired nicely with outdoor seating and a lager. Can't wait to try their dinner items in the future!

This place makes me want to learn German every time i go.

I would get my Polka clothes out any day of the week.

Great food, great prices, great atmosphere.

The fall months are great to sit outside and enjoy the weather to a Brat sampler.  LOVE IT!

This place is always a 4-5 star for me, but as of late, I'm worried they're slipping. Last time we went in, they had a seriously condensed menu that left off some of the items we always ordered. Namely, the stuffed cabbage -- something anyone with a eastern/central European family grew up with (and they did it really well). Super bummed about that. When we asked the server, he said they changed it for Glendale Glitters, and haven't changed it back since. I really hope the old menu makes a comeback, because there's maybe 15-20 options on this one, and there were more than double on the prior menu.

I came to this place on a Sunday exploring West Phoenix beer options (beyond the bud light crowd) and was not disappointed. We had pretzels and sausages in the bar where the bar tender was knowledgable about their beers and very helpful. On that trip, we bought tickets to Octoberfest here and brought our families in October. We had a blast!

The food is uniformly good and the beer comes in liters. It is like drinking from a fish bowl. Who wouldn't like that?!

The German food here was absolutely amazing. Some of the best food in general I've had in Phoenix. The stuffed mushrooms are undescribable he good in the pork shank was incredibly tender and flavorful they clearly cook it the right way. Our server was super super kind and the service was fast. Can't wait to go back!

Nothing will ever be as good as my mother's cooking, but this will do. Our waitress was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. She also checked in on us enough, but wasn't overly pushy. 
We had the sauerkraut puffs to start. I wouldn't say they were puffs, but they were delicious. They seemed more potato based and really heavy. I would still order these with the intention of taking them home for later. 
I had the roulade and it was very tender. Still not my mother's cooking, but it will do! The red cabbage to me, was missing something, but it wasn't enough to not eat it. For the life of me I can't remember what my husband ate. I just remember it being a "spicy braut", but not the one that was intended to be spicy. Perhaps the wonderful waitress that suggested it to us will do the same. 
For desert we had the apple strudel with real cream. It was delicious! You maybe thinking the portions were small, but they weren't. We ended up taking most of it home because there was so much food! I will add pictures.

Looking for something new instead of the boring places you usually go to? If so, then this is the place for you. Fun and lively, this place has a great atmosphere! The beer selection is fantastic and they have many specials that appeal to everyone.

Vegetarian? Don't worry, they have spaetzle and some great, huge pretzels.

Highly recommended

This wasn't a typical restaurant visit - we had a group of Toastmasters friends set up a meeting for 24 in the bar area, and we had a fixed menu for our group.  

What I liked - fun venue, lively energy (live accordion music playing on the patio!).  The beer (heifeweissen) was wonderful (holy cow - the large comes in a stein that I could hardly lift!!).  The sausages, sauerkraut and schnitzel was fabulous.  Desserts (cherry and apple strudel) were decent. 

They have a large bar area with TVs and lots of seating; an extended patio area and a front dining room that was a little quieter. 

The servers were a delight.  However - it was weird.  They knew that our group would be giving speeches and conducting a meeting.  But they put us in the high traffic area in the bar.  The manager even bumped into the speaker (who was forced to stand in the walkway) instead of walking around, and gave us a look like we were in her way. It was just too darn noisy to hear more than 10 feet away.  I grant that maybe we picked the wrong location for a meeting.  But then why didn't the manager (knowing we were coming and what we were doing) put us in that location?  

I'm sure this restaurant is a delight if you are just coming in for a fun German food experience. Although my hubby was disappointed about the mustard they provided. So I'm giving a 4 star rating for the experience that "regular" diners were having. 

This venue is across town from us - although I love the downtown Glendale vibe - I most likely won't make the long drive to come back anytime soon.

Not bad but I have had much better.

Tried the combo plate with a sampling of various sausages, schnitzel, meatloaf and ham. The sausages and ham were the best part. Ham had a nice smoky flavor and was very tasty. 

They had a couple of dipping sauces including dijon mustard (from a bottle) and a curry ketchup that tasted like your bottled ketchup with curry powder. 

 Schnitzel was overcooked and dry and almost rubbery. Spatzel was watery and almost tasteless. Potatoes were very oily and not very flavorful. meatloaf was soft and spongy and packed with flavor but I have had much better.

Overall - the things that were done right - sausage and ham - were very good but the  things that were not done as well were more of a dissapointment.

Ok so I have to start with the fact that I love German food and everywhere I travel I search out German Restaurants. With that said I have been to every kind from good to bad to great. This place lands somewhere in between good and great. 


Atmosphere: it is really cute with old world charm. Think grandma's kitchen with plates and artwork on the wall. Kick knacks around. The dining chairs are comfortable. Sometimes restaurants have the uncomfortable kind so as to get you to leave sooner. 

Also because it was mentioned prior it was cool and there seemed to be no ac problems. 

Service: service was a 5 out of 5 attentive without being over bearing and friendly. 

Drink: I ordered and orange blossom and it was like an elevated screwdriver. Also an ice tea and it was good not old or bitter. 

Food: the thing everyone wants to know. I had the roulade with an extra side of German potato salad because I wanted to try it. Also It came with soup of the day a beef and barley. The soup was tasty and had a good broth. 

The roulade was really nice as was the spetzel and cabbage. I can say that the food was a 5 out of 5. The cabbage has a nice depth of flavor. The potato salad is served warm with a minimal amount of dressing. The roulade is spot on not dried out at all. Nothing was over seasoned. 

I also had to breakdown and have an apple dumpling. OMG I think I just got sent to pastry heaven.

Had one lunch while visiting the area and was surprized how mediocre the food was, considering some glowing reviews.
Goulasch soup was adequate, not great. No German bread with it, just a pack of soup crackers. Jaegerschnitzel was tough meat and had no taste, and the mushroom sauce on it tasted like it was premade brown sauce out of a can.  A giant chocolate cake slice was served with a glob of what was supposed to be cream, but it was not real cream (tasted like cool whip).
I never had anything this uninspiring in many years in Germany. Maybe I ordered the wrong things.

Service was friendly and attentive and seating was comfortable.

After a long cross country journey, this was our last stop on our way 
home. It ended up being the highlight of all the resturaunts. I had the saurbraten and absolutely loved it. Staff was great

Went for Oktoberfest so this might be biased! Lived it. Huge beer check. German style seating, check, traditional German restaurant owner, check. Felt like my Mom's ( She is German but won't cook for me anymore)! Had Jagerschnitzel was delicious and tender. I used a plastic knife and fork so. Felt the real spirit of Germany inside and out. Our server was German so we ordered auf Deutsch. I'll be back to try the full menu but everyone in the group loved the traditional specials. Eisbein and schweinehaxe Warren lecker!

We absolutely love this place! Not for the health food crowd, but definitely for people who do not mind pounded, fried meat and giant beer. They rotate between 4-5 soups and each are delicious and come with every dinner or you can opt to get a German salad for about $2.00 more.  It is impossible to leave this place still feeling hungry.

The service isn't very good sometimes, but we've never been disappointed with the food. We usually get the pretzel for an appetizer (delicious) and the chicken schnitzel for dinner. Some of the best German food I have ever had and the beer is great too!

Although we have been here many time brought countless number of guest to enjoy this place, as of recently we have had bad experiences. 45 minute wait for an appetizer followed by 30 min wait for our dinner order. Food over cooked and chasing our waiter for water and coffee, forget a refill, you would have to get it yourself. The surrounding waiters will not attend to you. The manager will walk by numerous times and not acknowledge your waiting so long for each phase of the meal. Also if you get there for a late lunch beware! If you sit outside and your waiter gets transferred inside you are left without service. If you bring this to their attention most likely you will get no resolution. How unfortunately as we have introduced this place to many and are sorry for the loss of this once nice place to bring guest.

This is a quaint and cute place to eat authentic German food when the mood hits.  Really liked it overall.
Had the 6 sausages with sauerkraut and potatoes which was good--not fantastic--but good.  For dessert split two desserts with a friend which was apple struedel (the very best I have ever had) and the chocolate sauerkraut cake which was sooo chocolatey.  Loved the struedel most.
Tasted the giant pretzel which is good, but to me not worth the $8.95 which is kinda pricey for what it was.  I mean, really?  Flour and water and $8.95?
Regardless, if I ever crave in my entire lifetime German food this is where I will go.  
It's good, but there was a German restaurant in Houston that blows this place out of the water which I wish was duplicated here in Phoenix but isn't.
Overall, okay place...just the food didn't want to make me yodel at all.
One of the best places in town! Amazing food, great atmosphere and fun staff! We'll be back for sure.

Here is why this gets the Five Starts:

1. Independently owned with the owners actually there working
2. Authentic German Food done VERY well
3. Amazing staff that understand the menu and doesn't make fun of you for pronouncing anything wrong.
4. LARGE outdoor bier garden in historic downtown Glendale
5. Das Boot - You can get a real German bier in a large Glass Boot.
6. Best from scratch pretzel you could ever dream of. 

The overall atmosphere is one that is just fun and very different from anything else I've found in the Valley.

First time tonight! WOW! Amazing food, atmosphere and they LOVE dogs! Pet Friendly. Awesome service. The owner brought out different sausages for my dog. The Chocolate Martini's were D'Lish and my husband LOVED his beer German Hef. We will for sure be back, our food was so yummy...from the appetizer brie to brats and my pork dish, wow. You won't be disappointed.

Never a disappointment. We live in the East Valley and this is our go to spot for Hubby's Birthday, and a few other times during the year when we just have to have German food. Having been to Germany a few times we know what the food should taste like, and Haus Murphy's definitely fixes our cravings!  Worth the Drive!!!

HOLY MOUNTAIN OF FOOD! Fast service, extensive beer menu, great and pretty authentic german food. The pretzel is the largest I have ever seen. If your a fan of "man food" because that is what german food is, check out this place!

We ate at Haus Murphy's about a year ago for the first time, and absolutely LOVED the food.  Everything we ordered was delicious, and it was a fun atmosphere.  We decided to eat here for Mother's Day this year, and were sorely disappointed by our experience and will likely never go back.

We made a reservation for 6pm and arrived about 5 minutes early with our entire party of 6 present.  We were seated almost immediately and ordered our food about 5-10 minutes later.  Our order included an Eisbein, combo plate for 2, and meatloaf, along with a giant pretzel as an appetizer.  45 minutes after we placed our order, we were served side salads, and a few minutes after that the waitress came to the table and apologized, saying that the Eisbein was sold out for the day and asked if we would like to order something else.  She assured us when we placed the order that they had some left, and she had reserved one for us, yet it took them 45 minutes to realize they couldn't even make one of our main dishes.  We placed an order for Paprika Schnizel instead.

By the time we finished the small side salads, we had been at the restaurant for almost an hour and our appetizer pretzel still hadn't even arrived.  We saw a waitress come out of the kitchen with a giant pretzel, relieved that we were finally receiving our appetizer, but the waitress put the pretzel down on the table next to us, who had arrived long after we had already placed our order.  When we asked the waitress why our pretzel still hadn't come out yet and the table of people who arrived after us already had theirs, she went back to "ask the kitchen" what had happened.

After several more minutes and no food in sight, we decided to leave and ate at our favorite Chinese Restaurant instead.  We were so pleased with our last visit that it is a shame the service was so horrendous.  I doubt we will ever be back.  There is no excuse for making us wait over an hour without even being served an appetizer.

A little chilly and spitting out last night in Glendale, but it was warm and dry in the outside eating area of Haus Murphy's.  I've hear about this place for years and anted to go there and decided to hit Glendale Glitters too.

 We shared their mushrooms, their spicy brat, and their Paprika Schnitzel. My girlfriend had a couple of glasses of their seasonal wine that was spiced and warmed. I had 2 liters of their "Spaten Optimator - Double bock beer with a rich malty flavor and molasses undertones.". 

The food was wonderful.  The service was excellent.  The music was entertaining. The beer was wonderful. It was a wonderful date night experience!

I love this place. The food is always amazing traditional German Food and all the beer choices leave you in wonder. My daughter and I always order the pretzel too which is fabulous! This is a must stop when you are in downtown Glendale!

I used to live in Germany and my boyfriend's Oma would make rouladen. Most favorite German dish! I was super excited to enjoy it again and I wasn't disappointed with the rouladen other than the fact I was looking forward to the mini pickle in the middle that I thought was standard? Maybe it was just a family thing. I was not impressed at all with the spaetzle. It was flavorless. Could have used a visit to the sautee pan with some butter and spices. Definitely opt for the potatoes instead which are so flavorful and decadent! Potato pancakes were decent and the cherry struedel was very true to german bakery style. Service was just ok. I was bummed our server didn't go over specials because we overheard another server telling his table about them and they sounded delicious! Oh well. I'd say we'll try the specials next time but I rarely get in the mood for German food and its a bit pricy to be visited often.

My wife and I got a chance to come here on a saturday night. 
We sat on the patio and there was 2 guys playing music. Pretty loud.

We ordered a big azz pretzel that was great and my wife couldnt stop talking about it for days afterwards. It was the best pretzel ever.

They do take there time bringing out the food and getting the check, so plan on being there for awhile. 

We ordered a schnitzel, the swiss style one. Its kind of like a corden on bleu but with pork and it has some very suttle flavors, nothing over powers anything.

We would definitly go back and if you do go, make sure you get a pretzel

Due to misunderstanding regarding our order, was given the opportunity to sample more items than expected: Bauernplatte combo for two.  I'm not usually a sausage fan, and have actually never eaten Bratwurst, but the German Bratwurst (pork) and Spicy Bratwurst (beef) were actually rich, smooth, and flavorful.  My husband enjoyed the Kassler Kotelett (pork chop), but neither of us were impressed with the Hackbraten (German meatloaf) or Schwabische Spatzle (noodles).  I have to admit, I've eaten a lot of sauerkraut in my life, and the stuff here is pretty darned good.  The German potato salad and fried potatoes were good as well.  The pork schnitzel was fine, but could use some additional seasoning.  Finally, we also tried the bread pudding, which was cold, and tasted more like unbaked bread dough than real bread pudding.  Outdoor patio is spacious and pleasant.

We stepped into the restaurant on a hot summer evening dressed in shorts and tank tops. The AC  made the front part of the restaurant too cold for us so they led us to the back(this place is huge!) where our server happened to be named AC...least I think that was his name, little Irish Italian guy who does a pretty legit pronunciation of German menu items. He was super hyper and enthusiastic about his love for the place. He expressed genuine love and admiration for the owners, and the business they built, and he totally made our night. 

Summer is the slow season in town as sweltering 100+degrees drive people away. It's a shame that this restaurant isn't always packed to the brim because it's located in a cute historic part of town within an old brick building and it has so much character.

The former business, which was an old soda/pharmacy/ice cream shop, was named Murphy's. As an homage to the former business the German owners, when they took over the location named their restaurant Haus Murphy's and thus we get a German/Irish hybrid named restaurant that causes a bit of disgruntled murmurs with German/Irish patrons. Descendants ask is this a German restaurant or an Irish restaurant? 

This is a 100% authentic German restaurant. Once a year they reconcile the controversy with their name by making and serving amazing corned beef during St. Patty's day, and you can wash it down with one of the in house German beers. No Guiness! They stick to their roots here which is what I like. They know where and when to compromise with their food, and I'm glad they are stubborn about keeping the establishment as close to their German heritage as possible. 

Sauerbraten was what we ordered. It was one of the dishes featured on Diners and Drive in and was labeled on the menu with a little icon to indicate that. The meat is marinated in spices for many days to achieve it's smoky clove scented flavor. It was really a delicious sauce which I tried to
sop up every inch of. I also loved the spaetzl noodles. They were delicious as the noodles in chicken noodle soup, and they were equally as tasty on their own as a side which I used to sop up the sauerbraten sauce.

We finished with a slice of the sauerkraut chocolate cake. You couldn't taste the sauerkraut one bit and the cake disappointed us. The cake wasn't as moist as we would've liked and instead all the moistness came from the dense and intense chocolate frosting. 

Overall a great experience, albeit a bit on the spendy side. The Sauerbraten dish was priced at $19. Yikes!

Definitely worth the hype! We've been talking about going to Haus Murhpy's for a long time and finally made it a couple weeks ago with another couple we are friends with.  Appetizers were big enough to share, the entree's were HUGE.  Food was amazing, prices even better...service was excellent. Outdoor patio was a great surprise - will make for an awesome place to hang out on nice days.  I cannot wait to go back!  YOU HAVE TO Try the Schnitzel!!!

We live in Queen Creek,  but were at Gila River arena for an afternoon concert, and were looking forward to having dinner afterward at Haus Murphy's,  as it's been years since we were there.  It was around 6pm when we arrived and were seated out on the patio (6 in our party).  Although it was chilly out that night,  they have many outdoor heaters which made dining outside quite comfortable.   The patio area was comfortable, but there were a few tables that were pretty loud, so the atmosphere felt more like a college bar hangout vs a family friendly environment.  When ordering drinks,  my husband and I found they were out of our first choice so we settled on something else.   For dinner,  it was jager schnitzel, soft pretzel with cheese spread for the table, and I ordered the patato pancakes as my meal.  There were 4 others in our party and they ordered bolognese, and more jager snitzels.  Expect to enjoy a beverage or two before your meal arrives.   Or in my case, doesn't arrive.  We were served, minus the pretzel and the potato pancakes.  Eventually,  the pc's arrived, but without sour cream since they were out of it,  but didn't mention it when I ordered.    And the pretzel made it,  but no cheese spread- no explanation. The others in my party were underwhelmed with the flavors of the jager snitzel.  In observing the bill,  we found we were over charged for one of our beers, which was promptly corrected, and we weren't charged for the pretzel and the potato pancakes.  We didn't ask for it to be comped,  so it was nice that they took care of it.

Last night was our first time eating at Haus Murphy's. My husband and I went to celebrate my birthday. It was delicious! Very authentic! Great atmosphere on the patio with great music. We couldn't decide what to eat so chose to share the platter for two (which is enough for 3-4). The pretzel for an appetizer was also excellent! Wish we would have saved room for dessert - next time!

I love Haus Murphy's! I live less than 2 miles away from the restaurant, and its definitely my favorite restaurant in AZ! The food is delicious, and the sauerkraut chocolate cake is a must have; can't go to the restaurant without getting it!
I enjoyed the menu, food and service.  It has a nice authentic feel.  They have a nice patio too.
The food is good, but the service is great. Oktoberfest is always a blast. The pretzel is great with the house made mustard, the strudel is awesome as well.

German food: What is German food? Is it good? These were two of my questions, prior to coming here. I absolutely love it! I love  the sauerkraut, the brauts, the schnitzel, and the pretzels! The food here is amazing and the service is terrific. Now I'm a German food lover.  Oktoberfest is almost here! We'll be reserving our table this coming week. Can't wait!!

Went earlier this week (mid-week) during Glendale Glitters, where they are busy but the food was no good. Because of the larger crowds they have a shortened menu (which is a bad thing to begin with, but I get it). The quality of the food has terrible, though (which is inexcusable): my wife's cabbage role was cold inside (fresh out of the freezer, perhaps?) and my sausages were just plain awful (who sells Nürnberger sausages that are spicy???).
Maybe they are just trying to make a quick buck from the crowds that probably won't be back anytime soon, but they are not doing themselves any favors. I won't be back...

Delicious food, great atmosphere, attentive service, and live music "Haus Band" on Friday and Saturday nights.  A great place for large groups, birthdays, and nice outdoor seating for any night.  Authentic German food as far as I am concerned...same with their beer.

I go here several times a year and absolutely love this place!  The pretzels, red cabbage, spaetzle, sauerkraut, schnitzel, you name it-and it is excellent here!  Oktoberfest is always a good time.  The staff is great.  My favorite dinner dish is the jäger schnitzel and my favorite lunch sandwich is the Reuben-best Reuben I've ever had.  They have a couple different German potato salads-both very good!  This place is a must try if you are near downtown Glendale.

You people that gave it a low rating, you have all wrong.  I've eaten at Haus Murphy's twice.  I've been to Germany......blah blah, etc.  It's a fine food establishment!  Downside......I ate tooooo much.  No regrets here!

My parents forced me to come here while they were visiting from NY. I was reluctant to come because I'm not a super big fan of German food.  However, this place may have changed my mind. Lets start with beer. Yes, beer. German, imported, deliciously large beer. They sell beer by the litre for about $11. Yes, that's right, 11 bucks. For a liter of good German beer!
Appetizers:  We got potato pancakes that were excellent! We were all fighting over them.  Good thing it was a large portion (good to share between 2-3 people).  
Mom and dad got some variety of schnitzel.  They have like 20 different kinds, so I can't remember. It came with homemade spaetzle that was awesome!
I got the home made bolognese. I can't pass up good home made pasta sauce. It was amazing. So worth it!  
We ordered a few desserts to go (it is family dinner after all) and all were good- the favorite was the sauerkraut cake. Sounds gross, but it was awesome. 
Definitely a must if you're in Glendale! They have an awesome patio/"beer garden" if you have a while to stay and hang out.  The service was excellent and the owners were just so lovely.  I'll definitely be back!
Megan & Jeremy have been amazing!!! The service was beyond perfect!!! I love this place, our first time here but definitely not our last time here. I'd definitely recommend this place

Good find! Food interesting! Would come back with a bigger crowd so I could sample more variety! Reny was attentive however a waitress at the front was complaining about work schedule loud enough for customers to hear full conversation!

Seriously get a german pretzel with mustard and a weihenstephaner hefe weissbier.
It's a match made in heaven. 
Best beer and pretzel combo I've ever had.
Lucy is an amazing waitress! She was so kind and wonderful during Oktoberfest! We were so impressed by her, she made the experience so enjoyable for us.

10/01

Had dinner with a group of yelp friends.  Thanks to Jim W. for organizing yet another fun event!  The weather was perfect and made for a relaxing dinner out in the patio.  

For dinner, I ordered the Krakauer Wurst, a spicy beef and pork sausage with a crispy sausage casing ("spicy" and "crispy" were the keywords in my choosing this dish!) platter, which included German fried potatoes, sauerkraut, and a bowl of chicken and cabbage soup ($9.95).  I would order this dish again!  Loved the spiciness and textures of the sausage (would I be able to enjoy trying out the other non-spicy dishes if I decide not to order the Krakauer on my next visit??), and the fried potatoes were very good- of course, I only ate the crispiest of the bunch.  I've been avoiding cabbage for many months now, but after sampling a taste of it tonight, I had to have more :)  I didn't taste the soup- that came home with me for my roomie to enjoy- but a few others received it with their meals, and the aroma was intoxicating!  BTW, I was also handed some horseradish on the side as part of the platter, but the sausage was spicy enough that I didn't need it.

For dessert, I ordered a slice of the German chocolate cake ($6.95?)- four layers of cake iced with homemade whip cream, cherry jam with cherries, and almond slivers coating one side.  A dollop of fresh whip cream placed beside it just added a little more sweetness to this lovely meal's end.  I would also order this confection again =)

I almost forgot!  Haus Murphy was gracious enough to offer two complimentary pretzels for the table.  While I had only a couple of small twists, I really enjoyed them!  I will surely order this on my next visit!

Schnitzel, Spatzle, and Pretzel oh my! Did I mention beer too? 
These are just a few of the reasons I love (and you will too) Haus Murphy's. Set in Old Town Glendale one may not think to look for this gem. 
I recommend the Jager Schnitzel: Mushrooms in brown gravy with a delightful piece of fried pork....hungry yet? 
My husband swears by the sausages, and beer served here. I agree with him on the beer...You are allotted a GIANT beer (if so desired, and frankly who wouldn't desire this?) with lovely flavor. 
The staff is friendly and helpful. Check this one out! Zer Goot!

Haus Murphy serves up a quintessential German experience. An authentic feeling enviroment with a selection of foods that not only a native could love, but anyone willing to step into a Black Forest story book will find tasty.  Despite it's Central Glendale location the place wasn't heavily patronized on our Friday night visit, still we had called ahead as suggested and set a reservation time. We were seated immediately, but were forgotten for almost a half hour. I  didn't realize how long we were sitting until my partner pulled out the cell phone to check. I was looking over the decor and commenting on the trinkets and chatting.When our server came to take our order they were profusely sorry and immediately put a large bread pudding on our food list, either to take home or eat at the end of our meal, whichever we wanted as an apology. 

From that moment on there wasn't a lack of attentiveness at all. The first two things that came were a Filet Salad and a Sausage appetizer. The salad was divine! Here is the description straight from their menu: 
"Slices of Filet Mignon, Radish Sprouts, Marinated Artichokes, Asparagus, Green Olives, Roasted Red Peppers, fresh Spring Mix, tossed in Lavender Vinaigrette, topped with quenelle of Herbed Goat Cheese...."  That's right, drift off with me....to that lovely description. The Olives were not oily, they were fat, plump, martini olives. The Filet was perfect.  A Lavender Vinaigrette? It was a WOW. But it's a limited time salad, so it may not be there when you visit.

Then came the sausage sampler. You no longer can choose the sausages you sample like the online menu states, and you get saurkraut not german fried potatoes, but it was still nice. They set a bottled mustard you can buy in any grocery store on the table.  I think it  would have been nice to have some sampling of german mustards for dipping. It was at this point that I noticed we didn't have a bread basket. I had read about Rye and Pumpernickle with a tapenade that comes at the beginning, so I inquired. Unfortunately this was a cost loser for the restaurant and they no longer do it. Instead they brought out three basic dinner rolls with the tapenade instead. This change dissapointed me as it's rare to get hearty breads and the tapenade doesn't go well on a basic dinner roll, they should just bring out some butter.

On to the dinners. It was so very hard to choose among the Schnitzles and Sausages, but we managed. One Nurn-burger Combo and a Schweizer Schnitzle later with a side of potatoe dumpling and we were quite sure we'd ordered plenty of food. The Tomato soup which prefaced our entree's was better than I expected. Neither of us like Tomato soup and both of us liked this one. I'd skip the potato dumpling side in the future it was a gooey mass of starch,  maybe we should have tried the Spaetzle instead. 

The Schnitzle was really good and the sausages juicy. I think I could try a different schnitzle each visit and be pleased. I also might consider just a sausage and a bun. They will bring a roll for your sausage if you ask. The Wirsing was very tasty, I had read it wasn't so good, but I was thrilled with it. In the end we were quite full, we had ordered some drinks and had forgotten the large promised bread pudding. It arrived and we ate what we could handle while the Tuba and Accordian duo played their way through the restaurant. 

A bit spendy, we hit $80 for the two of us, but we weren't trying to eat cheap. Careful planning could lower the cost. All in all it was quite festive and fun for an evening and we are glad we went. You should visit!
Authentic live music Fridays and Saturday's 6-8! Make such a fun atmosphere with even better food!

Stumbled upon this place while driving to the Chocolate Festival. My husband was thrilled as he LOVES German food. We decided to have lunch here after checking out the festival.

Being a lovely warm and sunny day we decided to sit outside....which is very cool...nicely decorated, big picnic tables and plenty of sunlight.

I ordered the Hackbraten (German Meatloaf) which was very good, the mashed potato and red cabbage were superb! With this I of course had to try a German beer.....I asked the waiter what he would recommend, he asked what type of beer I like and I said usually the darker ones...he recommended the Franziskaner Dunkel - an unfiltered dark wheat beer, dark roasted malt with a smoky roasted grain finish .... a great recommendation as it was just perfect with my meal.

My husband who is constantly craving Weisswurst Sausages was finally at peace having found it on the menu. He insisted I try some of his and said it would melt in my mouth....wow!...it actually does melt in your mouth....delicious. 

Our waiter was awesome as he knew everything on the menu so he was very helpful as well as very friendly and a great photographer! Everything you need in a waiter : )

The German music playing in the background was really festive and added to the great atmosphere. We will definitely be back!

Good German food at a great price.  Service to go with it too.  Can't go wrong here.

Baked Brie with lingonberries for an app!  Too good to pass up.  

We both got sausages and split them to share.  Happy with both.  And the potatoes and craut were pretty good too.

So then, why only 4 stars and not 5?  I don't know, just didn't seem like a 5 star review and there is no 4.5 option.

So if you want some good German grinds, with some beer or wine to go with, you can't go wrong here.

We called in for a reservation this past Monday, which I am grateful we did because they were packed! We sat on the patio and were very comfortable under the heat lamps. We were in a group of 6 so we started with a giant pretzel and bread assortment, both which were very good. One of the people in our party ordered the potato pancakes, unfortunately they were out of sour cream so she was overall disappointed with her meal. My parents both ordered the Jager Schnitzel, my mom enjoyed hers and my dad was not very impressed. My fiance ordered the Kilometer german sausage and really enjoyed his dish. He generally does not care for sauerkraut but really liked it! I ordered the Haus Made Bolognese and really enjoyed the fresh flavors. Our service was a little slow, which is not surprising with how busy they were. I would have given them an additional star if we were able to get refills without having to flag someone down or wait a long time. I would probably go back to Haus Murphy's based on the food experience alone.

Now, THIS is how to run a restaurant. Seriously, I'm NOT being sarcastic. I ordered an Ultimate Reuben, and it arrived cold, nearly ten minutes after every one else at our table was served! Must have been forgotten in the kitchen. The server took it back to have it reheated in the oven. 

Five minutes later, I tried it (four bites), and it was rubbery because of being reheated, gristly, and sliced too thick. I wasn't charged for the sandwich and was given a take-out slice of strudel for free. Not a great experience, but this is an example of how a restaurant should TRY to make things right!!! Sometimes, stuff happens.

The four stars are because I've been here before and have loved the food. 

The Jager Schnitzel is to-die-for. Should have ordered THAT tonight!

Had dinner here again with German friends from out of town. Food was excellent as it was every other time we dinned here. Authentic German food prepared fresh. Excellent service too. Very crowded with it being the holidays and we only waited 25 minutes for a table for four with no reservation. Went to the bar for drinks while we waited and chatted with the friendly bar keep. Had a great time.

This place is really good, lots better than our German place back in Lexington, KY but we are still debating whether it is better than Bayrischer Hof in Cabarete or the Hofbrauhaus in Newport, Kentucky. Either way it's in the same vicinity.(quality wise, obviously as far a way from each other as I have ever traveled)
 
Started with the huge pretzel which was very warm and fresh. The cheese was pretty good and the horseradish mustard was great.
 
The beer was really good and toof bustin cold! See previous review if you need a translation!

By this time we backtracked on our original plan of ordering two entrees and decided to split one and add a side of the potatoe pancakes.
 
We ordered the Guy Fieri recommended Paprika Schnitzel and it did not disappoint! Great flavor and was thicker than your usual schnitzel. It did have a sweet flavor as mentioned by a fellow Yelper but it went really well. We loved it. The potatoe pancakes were absolutely amazing. We ordered a side of there mushroom gravy for comparative purposes and it was amazing. I thought it was the best we had ever had but my wife still favors the mushroom gravy at Bayrischer Hof In Cabarete Dominican Republic (a must try hole in the wall if in Cabarete)

As to the service, probably why I didn't go with a five star. By no means was the service bad but it was a little slow and the waiter was really busy and running from table to table so he was not very friendly. He wasn't rude either just kind of indifferent. No one there was really overly friendly but they were busy. To be clear they were not rude at all. We may have higher expectations of our staff when we eat out. There seemed to be a going through the motion attitude at several places we visited in Arizona. There seems to be more willingness to be genuinely friendly back home. This may not be a fair representation of Arizona since we were only here a short amount of time but it was our impression.  We certainly have experienced the same back home but just not as a usual thing.

Overall, don't let the service deter your visit. We are anxious to return to try more menu items- next time in AZ we will return!!

We've been coming here for a while, and I was surprised to see I've never left a review.  Well, that is going to be remedied tonight!

Hubby and I love coming here, we both adore their schnitzel...he likes the chicken and I like the jager (pork loin).  It's always on point, and feels like someone's nana is in the back making each dish that comes out.  We were both commenting on that tonight, it seems so homey and comforting whenever we eat here.

We normally order the pretzel for an appetizer, which comes out fresh and hot (and HUGE) along with a beer cheese dip and spicy mustard dip...so delish!  We didn't get that tonight, just our entrees.  But, the entrees include a cup of soup, which we thoroughly enjoyed.

We did decide to share a dessert (which we don't normally do), and went with the apple streudel.  It's served with a vanilla sauce, ice cream and whipped cream.  The plate was completely empty when we were done.

The service was really good, our server was very friendly and we both enjoyed our dining journey to Germany...until next time...
LOVE LOVE LOVE!  the food is German home cookin'.  Make sure you get there when the Oompah band is playing.  Beer is great, food is great, and the service is always good.

Not really a beer garden, or at least not like the ones I'm used to. It was my first time having a Schnitzel so I thought it was pretty good. They didn't have that many beer on tap and what they did have was just okay. 

FYI we heard that the Restaurant Stakeout (or whatever the show was called) was all staged... bummer.

This is a fun place to visit if you are looking for some hearty food and good beer! Fun outdoor seating and good German cuisine. My husband and I have gone here quite a few times and always have a good experience!

The oompa band was a blast!  I visited last night and enjoyed the place! Went early before the Glendale lights and a local theater performance. Sat at the bar where I enjoyed a bit of German Suds. We had the stuffed mushroom appetizer and probably would not have that again. Broiled shrooms w really good Italian sausage stuffing. The combo of the melted Parmesan and then the balsamic vinegar just had too many tastes going on for us. The soup was a very good pork and apple!! We loved it! We shared the pork shank w sauerkraut and German fried potatoes. Very nice. The Tuba player from the oompah band was engaging and they played for us at the bar. We had a blast and would definitely return.

If you like big German style, then this is the place for you.

All the classic meals, friendly wait staff, and you can get your beer in a fish tank.

Went to Haus Murphy's on a Sunday afternoon around 3pm. This was our first visit so we took our exchange students from Germany with us. We drove all the way from Queen Creek (about an hour) They were very excited about an authentic German meal. They shared the $35.00 "variety" platter to share and I had the Saur Bratten. The food was sub-par and luke warm. The meats were tough and chewy and the schnitzel was over cooked. When one of the German boys asked for ketchup the waitress asked "what are you going to ruin with that?" She then tried to tell them "That's not what they put on schnitzel in Germany"  and proceeded to almost argue with them about it.  I felt this place was overpriced and the service was horrible! I will not be driving back again.
Uber German place! I love it!! The food is amazing and the beers are huge!! I got the kilometer but have tried a bunch of different dishes. All have been the best I have had in the Valley!

We decided to grab a bite to eat while at Glendale Glitters, luckily it was a week before it closed so it was on the slow side.  This place always is packed when we walk by, especially the patio!  We got a table on the patio by a heater cause it was chilly  that night.  Ordered the lightest beer they had and it was great!  Ordered the brie cheese and sausage appetizers and they were delish!!!  What a great place...we heard it was on Diners, drive-ins and dives and glad we finally stopped!  Check them out...

I was out in Glendale for a graduation event and my friend, who was driving, was originally from Germany so I recommended we try out this place. I have to say, love the location in old town Glendale and rather charming decor with waitresses dressed in traditional German garb like you would see at an Octoberfest in Munich, which occurs in September, not October, but whatever. 

As for the food, a bit off from what I've had in Germany - their Schnitzel here came across more like a chicken fried steak and the crust was not as crispy as I've had in Germany (I'm not from there but have visited several times). The one thing I did notice, and I appreciate the German beers on tap, was that the beer tasted just a bit off, and generally that is an indication that the establishment just needs to clean and sanitize their lines for their taps. I'm a home brewer so I may be more picky about this than most but I had my friend try the beer and she noticed the difference as well. 

We also had the apple strudel for desert and it was okay - part of the overall German meal experience. For me, charming place, a unique food experience but relative to the prices point I wouldn't say it was the best German meal experience I've had in Phoenix but it was till fun. All I ask, flush out those taps but I would definitely eat here again if I was in the area. :-)

I would probably give this 4 1/2 stars may be even five.  This place is fantastic.  For those who have traveled to Germany - this is the place to go that will bring back all your favorite memories.  First I have to give them kudos for having authentic German beer (my favorite is about 4th or 5th, a wheat beer that is a little darker than a hefenweizen).  Both times I have gone we had the potato pancakes - these are a bite of greatness.  Also the schnitzel is wonderful, I recommend the Paprika schnitzel.  Dessert - bread pudding is delicious!! I would highly recommend this place.   Specially to people who can appreciate German food, beer, and flavors.

Haus Murphy's was my first German food experience ever. The cuisine was OK but it isn't something I'd shove people down to get to. 

I went with a friend who lived in Germany for a bit and he said that Murphy's wasn't quite up to par. 

We ordered the sausage sampler as an appetizer. The sausages were tasty, but they were a bit cold. For something that is labeled a "sampler", I felt disappointed with only two types of sausages served in it. I don't know for sure what types they were, but they didn't taste unique to me, as it seems like you can purchase them in the meat section of any supermarket. 

The sausages were served with three types of condiments. A sweet style mustard, a Dijon style mustard, and ketchup blended with curry, which I'm told is a recent favorite of the German kids brought over from Turkish immigrants. 

For our entrees, we all had some type of schnitzel. That same friend told me to try the Wiener schnitzel as it is the representative item when you think of German cuisine. So all our schnitzel's came out and mine was the blandest. My friend's schnitzels had different gravies, toppings, and stuff and my poor little Wiener schnitzel was just bland and all alone. You have to get that Wiener schnitzel wet with gravy ! 

No biggie, I'm a foodie so I'll eat it. A schnitzel is basically German country fried pork. Not super exciting. I copied my friend who lived in Germany and substituted potatoes on the side for spatzle, as I wanted this experience to be as authentic as possible. I don't know if it's just Haus Murphy's, but the spatzle was kind of bland, even with the gravy. 

I do however like the word spatzle. If I ever visited Germany, I would only say spatzle, to everyone. I also liked the other thing that was served with the entree. It was kind of like a mashed potato mixed with some creme sauce, onions and some kind of green vegetable or herb (probably spinach). 

The beer here was good authentic German beer. I didn't get drunk, but I still don't remember what kind I had, you'll have to experiment. 

Service was excellent. I read some reviews that said Murphy's was slow but everything came out quickly and evenly for us. The waitress was very friendly and they spoke lovely German (not that I speak ANY German, but it sounded sexy). She was very helpful in describing everything, from the food to the beer.

I ordered a BAP (big ass pretzel) to go. Philly is known for some pretty good pretzels and this BAP was good. It was expensive, but it came out warm, soft & chewy. The only thing is they went a little heavy on the salt. 

To steal and modify a quote from a Seinfeld episode: "That big ass pretzel made me thirsty"!  

Note* They don't actually have it on the menu as a BAP.

Would I return to Murphy's? Ehhh, yeah to try some of the other things, but I definitely can't see it as a place that I would be a regular at.

This place has great German food and beer. Dining inside is okay, but in the cooler months the patio outside is the place to be. I have been here several times and they have never messed up my order, the food is good and the staff is nice. Closest thing to German food, short of being in Germany!

This is not really a fair review. I'm reviewing this like I would if this place had been in Germany - but it's Phoenix, and I acknowledge that, so I'm bumping it up one star. Honestly, the food wouldn't have passed muster in Germany.
The "famous sauerbraten" was gray and chewy. The cabbage was good, the spatzel was OK - though I'm more partial to the grated spatzel. The bread dumpling didn't really have anything going for it. This, after tip, was $28?
I didn't hear any German (other than the piped in polka songs), or see anything of modern Germany, just uncomfortable servers in complicated uniforms. With plastic tablecloths.
I'm pretty sure I'm not the target audience for this place, which is too bad. I've been searching for a German place in Arizona that works for me for years now.

Sigh. Maybe their schnitzel is better?

I have absolutely nothing bad to say about Haus Murphy's. Consistently good food and service. Fun atmosphere and staff. I prefer the goulash, which is rich and meaty. The red cabbage is tasty and sweet. The beers are strong and cold. I often visit with my German adopted-grandfather and he converses with one of the waiters fluently and it always has hilarious results.

If your ever in there get Alex. Guaranteed not to let you down. Friendly, service was absolutely fantastic and the food was real good. Price is competitive and delicious. I never give 5's as a score but the waiter deserved it

Before reaching the entrance we could hear the delightful Bavarian Oompah band. The restaurant had a big crowd. We had a 6:30 reservation and were immediately seated outdoors on the patio as requested. The patio provides an authentic German beirgarten environment including the  band. Our waitress was excellent and provided pleasant and attentive service from beginning to end. We had the sampler platter for two which is pictured on their website and which was, of course, is very German. Also loved the dark German beer and dessert.  We came for the German experience and food and Haus Murphy knows how to provide it big time.

Deliciousness 3.5/5
Happiness 4.5/5

I enjoyed this place far more than I anticipated. It is a very pork-heavy menu (which I don't eat), but the beef sausage and chicken schnitzel were good. What were really outstanding were the garlic soup (I even ordered an extra bowl... in 100 degree heat!) and giant pretzels (a seasonal offering. Too bad since it was one of the best pretzels I've ever had). 

But let's be honest, you come here for the beer. It's expensive, but it's the real McCoy (or, because it is a German restaurant, the real Uter? Yay Simpsons!). Plenty of German ale selections I hadn't even heard it. Yes, they had a beer boot. No, I was not able to chug it all at once despite my best efforts. The drinks are delicious, especially when enjoyed in their outdoor patio. 

This is a pretty unique place with some very authentic German food and beer. Definitely nice for a change to the fare offered by most restaurants.

Great patio for an afternoon lunch.  We took our dogs and the wait staff was very nice to them, they bought a large bowl of water right away and made sure we had plenty of shade.

The food was great, We started with stuffed mushrooms, the sausage stuffing in them was terrific and we really enjoyed them, I had the Sauerbraten and my husband had the Paprika Schnitzel for our entrees. Both were flavorful and tasty and the portions were quite large. We did manage to save enough room to split a dessert and had the bread pudding, it was delicious.

Can't wait to go back and try some of their other offerings.

went there for sunday dinner before Sunday nite Packer game.  our party of 4 sat out in the biergarten for beer and appetizers - had the pretzel and haus cheese with 4 rolls. we ordered too much bready but it was good.   the staff was accommodating when we asked nicely to move indoors for our entrees, due to flies coming out wanting our appies.  we ordered 3 different dinners and shared which was plenty of food after appies and soup.  enjoyed a schnitzel, sauerbraten (a little chewy/dry)  and Hungarian wurst (lots of great flavor).  mostly loved the dumpling and spaetzle and blaukraut and wirsing (creamed sauerkraut).  overall it's fun to go to a german place in Arizona with waitresses in dirndls and we had good enough food and service.

First of all I want to make sure to mention that the service was fantastic and that I could not have asked for a more polite and professional service.
Haus Murphy's food is okay at best and honestly I would not choose to return for dinner or lunch. I ordered the cheese-spread as an appetizer and the rye-bread that came with it was dry and old. 
The Jaegerschnitzel and the fried postatoes were okay, but the corn chowder was absolutely terrible. 
If you are looking for a fun place to have a beer, this would be a good place to go, but dinner or lunch I would not recommend at Murphy's Haus.

While I'm a fan of downtown Glendale I think this place fares a little above average in my book.  I'd put it between 3 to 4 stars but not near the upper half of that range.  I've been here several times and I feel like I'm trying to like the place during each visit.  I don't think that is a great sign, some places I can walk into and already know that the restaurant is a hit.

Things I did like was the nice looking decor, homey feeling, and the beer choices.  I also like the location smack dab in the middle of downtown and it's right across the street from an American Recovery project that is sprucing up an alleyway to make the area more appealing to pedestrians.  I'd like to see what this looks like when the project is finished.

Things I didn't like was the food, which is nothing to brag about.  The flavors are ok, but nothing to make me say wow that was a great meal.  Another thing, I know the place is supposed to look old, but it's on the verge of looking run down and dirty.  A little extra cleaning and maybe a few upgrades would change this opinion of mine.

Haus Murphy is still a great choice for experiencing a German restaurant here in the valley.  This place has much more potential to be a complete hit.

Holy crap! The best German Food in the state of Arizona, possibly the southwest region. Authentic food, beer and dessert. Located in beautiful downtown Glendale this restaurant has indoor and outdoor space, delicious spells wafting through the air.

Such good German food! The platter for two was such a great choice. The sausages were bomb and the schnitzel super crisp and golden. I definitely recommend taking the pretzel to go cold and heating it up at home. Such a tasty snack after. Will definitely be hitting this spot up again when we are back in Phoenix

First time having German food, so I'm not the best judge on authenticity. But I thought it was okay. I came here twice. The first time I came was about 5 years ago. I had the Combo for One and I enjoyed it. Second time I had a Schnitzel, which I thought was just okay and not as satisfying as it sounded. The service the second time lacked and weren't very attentive. Will I go back for a 3rd time? Probably not.

The best service ask for "Ryan's" table. Food is fantastic!! Best price for the amount of food! Bring an appetite and a feel for a good Polka! 
I urge everyone to visit here when in town for Oktoberfest, Beerfest, or after Spring Training.
Food was excellent, the server was friendly and attentive, it was a good value.  We were there on a Saturday evening.  It was noisy and the food was very slow coming out of the kitchen.

Talk about a turn for the worse. Tonight I had the most awful service of my several years of going to Haus Murphy on a regular (at least once a month!) basis. If you read my previous review, you'll see how happy I was up until this point, but that's changed after tonight. 

What happened? First the service was slow. Then the service became nonexistent. Were they busy? Not more than normal. Was our server overburdened? Not that I could tell. She was, however, absent minded and uncaring. 

Example? Our server brings our drinks and wanders off to other tables, not even asking (or caring, apparently) if we were ready to order at that point, which we of course were. Just plops down the drinks and leaves without a word. What the heck is that? 

My wife wants to substitute French fries for the potatoes, which she doesn't care for. We've done this a hundred times before, never ever been a problem. But tonight, with this server? "Oh there are no substitutions. It's printed on the menu here..." and she proceeds to point it out to my wife, even though I've just told her we have never had an issue getting it substituted and that we're long time repeat customers. Totally over her head. So she says to my wife, "Is it okay if they put it on the side?" referring to the fries. Of course, why wouldn't it be? 

So we get our food, fries come as a side order and there was no substitution. Our server later shows up when we're more than half done with our meal and asks if we want refills. I say yes, so she takes both of our drinks and walks off. She never returned with them. About 15 minutes later, after we're both finished eating, she comes by and has the unbelievable nerve to ask how everything is going, oblivious to the fact that there are no drinks on the table at all. I told her, bluntly, that it would have been much better if she'd brought our drinks back before we finished the food. "Oh, sorry," is her only response. She brings the drinks in 10 seconds flat, no follow up apology, no nothing. 

Another long delay, then I get the bill. Naturally they charged us extra for the fries rather than substituting. Mind you, she never told me that they would do that. Incensed, I go to the front to complain to a manager. I speak with a manager up there. I explain to said manager about the situation, to which she rudely and flatly responds, "Yeah that's right, there's no substitutions," and gives me this stare like I was babbling nonsense or something. I point out that I was not told we would be charged so she has the server come over and tell me, "No, I told you, remember? I asked if you were okay having it on the side." What?! That's not the same as asking if you can charge me extra. I tell her this, to which she responds, bluntly, "Well, that's what I meant." 

I paid the bill and left without giving her any tip at all. I really, really hate to do that, but if you're going to insult my wife's intelligence, take our drinks and not bring them back until we're done eating and then have the gall to refuse removal of a charge you did not tell me about, you're dreaming if you think you're getting a tip. 

I cannot begin to put into words just how upset this whole thing has made me. I loved this place, as is obvious from the earlier version of this review. The thought of never going back makes me sick, but so does the way my wife and I got treated tonight. I'm not going back until I get some kind of explanation and an apology from the server and the manager. I did give one of the owners a complete run down of what happened and I'm hoping something will come out of that. Will definitely update this review accordingly as that progresses, but right now they are getting the 1-star they deserve.

Its not often that I make my way to the West Valley,  but I was excited to make my way to Haus to indulge in some hearty German food.  My boyfriend and I made our way over for a family members birthday,  and we're instantly charmed with the decor. There were flags from several nations hanging in the patio area,  and a giant pretzel statue that said get ready to lose that top button of your jeans. 
We had a large group of people but the service was extremely friendly and responsive. Clearing plates and checking in on us often; which is nice when you have several avid beer drinkers in the group. The beer list was impressive,  and offered 32oz Steins for drafts. enjoyed a full bodied Hefeweizen. 
We ordered Bavarian Pretzels and the Brie platter for starters.  The pretzels were wonderful! Definitely the gem of the restaurant.  Warm,  soft,  and the perfect amount of salt.  Yumm!  The brie dish was a little boring. They got the right melted consistency,  but there was no bread or really anything to pair it with, and the sauce didn't win me over either. For dinner I ordered the Kilometer which was 3ft of beef sausage. The sausage was spicy and had a lovely smoky after taste,  but it was a little overcooked reminiscent to a Slim Jim.  I heard similar sentiments from two others about the meat being dry.  It was great to see a big helping of Kraut on my plate,  but the side of potatoes were a bit too greasy and bland for my liking. 
The meats are usually the headliner in a German restaurant and Haus Murphys were a little underwhelming. The food overall was a little bland for the price point ($14-$19 a plate). Come to Haus if you're looking for a damn good beer and a pretzel combo though.
This is the best real German food in the valley.  It gets super crowded so we come here early.  The owner is the nicest lady!

I ate here a few years ago with some friends, and I thought the food was mediocre at best. I've lived in Germany, so I know good German food. This wasn't it. Desperate for a taste of Germany, though, my husband and I looked up the menu online a few nights ago and decided it looked really great. Maybe my experience was a fluke! We hoped so anyway, as we set out about 30 miles or so across the city to eat at Haus Murphy's.

So we wait for about 30 minutes for a table and get a seat outside. It's a nice atmosphere, but immediately we notice the menu we've been given doesn't have a whole bunch of stuff on it that's on their website menu. We bring this up to the server and he tells us they serve a limited menu for 6 weeks during Glendale Glitters. 

We sit there and stew for about 5 minutes over this menu thing. None of the things we wanted to order are on this limited menu. We decide that's BS and get up and leave. We see our server and tell him we're leaving since their menu isn't the one advertised on their website. He tells us we should have called to check. Excuse me?? Is it my responsibility to call to make sure your website is updated?? What am I, your project manager??

Thanks a lot, Haus Murphy's, for wasting a couple of hours of our precious Saturday night time and about $15 in gas. Maybe you should update your website to let people know what you actually serve at your restaurant. Misleading advertising to say the least.
This place has the best German beer on tap! Good flavor and well worth the trip to try out. You will not be disappointed. Can't wait to come back!!

Give them an inch and they take the whole ruler! 

And by that, I mean their sausage platter. Hey girl heyyy! They taught me how to say, "sausage" in German but I completely forgot because I was full of tubed meats and beer. The food was exquisite and the beer came in a 32oz stein. It put me on my ass. I had to find me a bench because dang. I also had a bowl of soup and some schnitzel. It was way too much food but I was a happy camper. Easily the best $60 I spent in a while.

So come here for some beer and weiners! The large beeris indeed large!

My husband, my 14 month old and I went here Friday for the chocolate festival. I'd been there a few years before and remembered I didn't like it but couldn't remember why so I thought Id give it another try. I loved the pumpkin soup and the brie but the other food was just decent and we had horrible service. I had to ask 3 times for the heater next to us to be turned on and another 3 times just for silverware. Our waitress had a bad attitude and was flat out rude. She never refilled our drinks and it took over an hour to get our food. I understand when it's busy it's more difficult to focus on tables but she literally never came to our table on her own we had to get up and ask for her or flag her down for everything. The people sharing our table ordered the $5 beers and the waitress didn't even tell them the restaurant was out she just gave them beers that were $3 more a piece like they wouldn't even notice it on the bill. When they confronted her she rolled her eyes and treated them like dirt. We really are easy patrons, I've worked in the food industry so I make it a point to be patient and not flip out but seriously this waitress was the worst and it makes me angry that people are out there are struggling to find jobs and this woman has one and performs it horribly. I don't care how bad of a day you are having, when you go to work don't be lazy and rude just do it 100% because if you don't than there is someone out there who deserves that paycheck more than you. Also, and this has nothing to do with the rating, but the waitresses dress in German wear if you can even call it that and our waitress specifically was wearing was wearing an extremely low cut top, something that would give hooters a run for their money and she was practically spilling out, I'm far from a prude but it was distasteful and inappropriate and I shouldn't have to worry when I'm about to eat that my server is about to accidentally flash me. I get it, drunken men are probably going to tip the waitress with her chest falling out of her shirt pretty well but seriously save that kind of attire for a different establishment. I'm giving it one star based on our terrible waitress, the waiter at the table next to us seemed awesome and very attentive. We won't be going there again.
enjoyed  people present great service great menu was I lucky and wonderful accordion player

We love the food here! Any schnitzel is a winner! Good authentic German food and we appreciate that since we lived in Germany for a few years. This place let's is remember how much we loved the foods and also how much wr miss it!

So far, I can only review the bar for this place, but that's all one needs to be sold on Haus Murphy's. Virtually anything and everything I could think of was stocked in the dense cabinets, and the tap selection was amazing. Amazing, I tell you! Now, I've never had German beer, but my Dunkel Optimiser hit the spot and packed quite a punch. Would drink again, especially since you can get it as a 32. oz. Are you up to that challenge?

Of course, the overall atmosphere also rocks. I've walked by here a million times and seen the live polka and such. Consider this a place a glimpse of a culture you won't see too often around these parts. Can't wait to tell you about the food!
So goooood. Everyone is so friendly and the food is amazing. I highly recommend the saurkraut puffs appetizer they are my new love!
Really enjoyed the atmosphere and food here. Excellent service too. In the heart of downtown Glendale. Have eaten here a few times already and never disappointed either

I did not have Highhope's for this place, but was pleasantly surprised. The food tasted great, and was really well prepared. The staff was very friendly. The beers were great. Highly recommend going back here.

Reheated, insipid food and perfunctory service in a kitschy atmosphere.

We drove 32 miles from our house to Haus Murphy's because we were in the mood for German.  It was the middle of a Sunday afternoon so it wasn't very busy.

We ordered a couple of beers and the Bauernplatte combination for 2.  This includes several kinds of sausage, a pork cutlet, a schnitzel, a kind of hamburger in gravy, red cabbage, sauerkraut, spatzle and fried potatoes.  

It look great! Sadly, it all appeared to have been pre-cooked and then microwaved.  

Let me repeat that -  a precooked and microwave schnitzel!  The spaetzle in particular was a soggy, water-logged travesty.  $35 for this by the way.

So with two beers and tip, that was $60.00 for lunch. For microwaved food.

It's quite sad that they don't really care about the quality of food here.  This type of Bavarian food is fairly easy to prepare so it's hard to understand why they would have so much contempt for the customers or the lovely cuisine of Germany.

Any restaurant that would serve you reheated food like this really doesn't care about you or about the food they are serving.

I wish I had noticed the 50 filtered reviews before eating here.

This place is great fun.  Who would have thought you could feel like you were at a German beer garden while in downtown Glendale.   Sitting outdoors under the string lights and German beer flags just made you thirsty for beer! Nice selection of draft beers, all were tasty and available in 16 or 32 oz size.  Had sausage sampler with very good sauerkraut . Fresh pumpernickel and rye bread to munch on. Simple dinner salads.  Tried two types of schnitzel, both were great, wanted to order the gnocchi but they just ran out and then had the chicken Marsala which was just OK.
They had two accordion players playing classic tunes like the "chicken dance song" and "it's a small world after all".  Mmm good polka music and beer.  

This place does close at 9, otherwise it would be a great place to hang out all night.  Will go back again for sure.
Finally a place with Eisben!! A very nice German restaurant with very authentic cuisine, big portions and nice beers.

The bartender was good and friendly. My beef is with the owner who would not honor a 2 for 1 deal with one of the meals to go or give us a free pretzel as the 2nd meal. My friend that went with me could not eat anything on the menu because EVERYTHING had meat or egg in it except for the pretzel. Food was also just mediocre nor did the beer seem fresh.

The food was just ok. This was our time eating German cuisine. I don't know if this is actual German food or the Americanized Version of German food. For example like Chinese food, if you travel to China I can assure you won't find a Panda Express cuisine type restaurant anywhere. Panda Express is American Chinese food.
